   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Test the behavior of gen_udp. Testing udp is really a very unfunny task,
   23: %% because udp is not deterministic.
   24: %%
   25: %% (cd /mnt/c/$LOCAL_TESTS/26/kernel_test/ && $ERL_TOP/bin/win32/erl.exe -sname kernel-26-tester -pa c:$LOCAL_TESTS/26/test_server)
   26: %% application:set_env(kernel, test_inet_backends, true).
   27: %% S = fun() -> ts:run(kernel, gen_udp_SUITE, [batch]) end.
   28: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, [batch]) end.
   29: %% S = fun() -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_udp_SUITE}]) end.
   30: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}]) end.
   31: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, gen_udp_SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   32: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   33: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_udp_SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   34: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   35: %% T = fun(TC) -> ts:run(kernel, gen_udp_SUITE, TC, [batch]) end.
   36: %% T = fun(TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_udp_SUITE}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   37: %% T = fun(S, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   38: %% T = fun(S, G, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {group, G}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   39: %%
   40: 
   41: -module(gen_udp_SUITE).
   42: 
   43: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   44: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
   45: 
   46: 
   47: %% XXX - we should pick a port that we _know_ is closed. That's pretty hard.
   48: -define(CLOSED_PORT, 6666).
   49: 
   50: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0,
   51:          init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   52: 	 init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2,
   53:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   54: 
   55: -export([
   56: 	 send_to_closed/1, send_to_empty/1, active_n/1,
   57: 	 buffer_size/1, binary_passive_recv/1, max_buffer_size/1, bad_address/1,
   58: 	 read_packets/1, recv_poll_after_active_once/1,
   59:          open_fd/1, connect/1, reconnect/1, implicit_inet6/1,
   60:          recvtos/1, recvtosttl/1, recvttl/1, recvtclass/1,
   61:          sendtos/1, sendtosttl/1, sendttl/1, sendtclass/1,
   62: 	 local_basic/1, local_basic_binary/1, local_unbound/1,
   63: 	 local_fdopen/1, local_fdopen_unbound/1, local_abstract/1,
   64:          recv_close/1,
   65: 	 socket_monitor1/1,
   66: 	 socket_monitor1_manys/1,
   67: 	 socket_monitor1_manyc/1,
   68: 	 socket_monitor1_demon_after/1,
   69: 	 socket_monitor2/1,
   70: 	 socket_monitor2_manys/1,
   71: 	 socket_monitor2_manyc/1,
   72: 	 otp_17492/1,
   73: 
   74:          t_simple_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv/1,
   75:          t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv/1,
   76:          t_simple_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv/1,
   77:          t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv/1,
   78: 
   79:          otp_18323_opts_processing/1,
   80:          otp_18323_open/1
   81: 
   82: 	]).
   83: 
   84: -include_lib("kernel/src/inet_int.hrl").
   85: 
   86: -define(TRY_TC(F), try_tc(F)).
   87:                
   88: suite() ->
   89:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   90:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   91: 
   92: all() -> 
   93:     %% This is a temporary measure to ensure that we can 
   94:     %% test the socket backend without effecting *all*
   95:     %% applications on *all* machines.
   96:     %% This flag is set only for *one* host.
   97:     case ?TEST_INET_BACKENDS() of
   98:         true ->
   99:             [
  100:              {group, inet_backend_default},
  101:              {group, inet_backend_inet},
  102:              {group, inet_backend_socket}
  103:             ];
  104:         _ ->
  105:             [
  106:              {group, inet_backend_default}
  107:             ]
  108:     end.
  109: 
  110: 
  111: groups() -> 
  112:     [
  113:      {inet_backend_default,   [], inet_backend_default_cases()},
  114:      {inet_backend_inet,      [], inet_backend_inet_cases()},
  115:      {inet_backend_socket,    [], inet_backend_socket_cases()},
  116: 
  117:      {recv_and_send_opts,     [], recv_and_send_opts_cases()},
  118:      {local,                  [], local_cases()},
  119:      {socket_monitor,         [], socket_monitor_cases()},
  120: 
  121:      {sockaddr,               [], sockaddr_cases()},
  122:      {otp18323,               [], otp18323_cases()}
  123:     ].
  124: 
  125: inet_backend_default_cases() ->
  126:     all_cases().
  127: 
  128: inet_backend_inet_cases() ->
  129:     all_cases().
  130: 
  131: inet_backend_socket_cases() ->
  132:     all_cases().
  133: 
  134: all_cases() ->
  135:     [
  136:      send_to_closed,
  137:      send_to_empty,
  138:      buffer_size,
  139:      binary_passive_recv,
  140:      max_buffer_size,
  141:      bad_address,
  142:      read_packets,
  143:      recv_poll_after_active_once,
  144:      open_fd,
  145:      connect,
  146:      reconnect,
  147:      implicit_inet6,
  148:      active_n,
  149:      {group, recv_and_send_opts},
  150:      {group, local},
  151:      recv_close,
  152:      {group, socket_monitor},
  153:      otp_17492,
  154:      {group, sockaddr},
  155:      {group, otp18323}
  156:     ].
  157: 
  158: recv_and_send_opts_cases() ->
  159:     [
  160:      recvtos, recvtosttl, recvttl, recvtclass,
  161:      sendtos, sendtosttl, sendttl, sendtclass
  162:     ].
  163: 
  164: local_cases() ->
  165:     [
  166:      local_basic,
  167:      local_basic_binary,
  168:      local_unbound,
  169:      local_fdopen,
  170:      local_fdopen_unbound,
  171:      local_abstract
  172:     ].
  173: 
  174: socket_monitor_cases() ->
  175:     [
  176:      socket_monitor1,
  177:      socket_monitor1_manys,
  178:      socket_monitor1_manyc,
  179:      socket_monitor1_demon_after,
  180:      socket_monitor2,
  181:      socket_monitor2_manys,
  182:      socket_monitor2_manyc
  183:     ].
  184: 
  185: sockaddr_cases() ->
  186:     [
  187:      t_simple_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv,
  188:      t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv,
  189:      t_simple_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv,
  190:      t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv
  191:     ].
  192: 
  193: otp18323_cases() ->
  194:     [
  195:      otp_18323_opts_processing,
  196:      otp_18323_open
  197:     ].
  198: 
  199: 
  200: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  201: 
  202:     ?P("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  203:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  204:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  205: 
  206:     case ?LIB:init_per_suite(Config0) of
  207:         {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  208:             SKIP;
  209: 
  210:         Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
  211:             
  212:             ?P("init_per_suite -> end when "
  213:                "~n      Config: ~p", [Config1]),
  214:             
  215:             %% We need a monitor on this node also
  216:             kernel_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  217: 
  218:             Config1
  219:     end.
  220: 
  221: end_per_suite(Config0) ->
  222: 
  223:     ?P("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  224:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  225:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  226: 
  227:     %% Stop the local monitor
  228:     kernel_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  229: 
  230:     Config1 = ?LIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
  231: 
  232:     ?P("end_per_suite -> "
  233:        "~n      Nodes: ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
  234: 
  235:     Config1.
  236: 
  237: init_per_group(inet_backend_default = _GroupName, Config) ->
  238:     [{socket_create_opts, []} | Config];
  239: init_per_group(inet_backend_inet = _GroupName, Config) ->
  240:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  241:         true ->
  242:             %% The environment trumps us,
  243:             %% so only the default group should be run!
  244:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
  245:         false ->
  246:             [{socket_create_opts, [{inet_backend, inet}]} | Config]
  247:     end;
  248: init_per_group(inet_backend_socket = _GroupName, Config) ->
  249:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  250:         true ->
  251:             %% The environment trumps us,
  252:             %% so only the default group should be run!
  253:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
  254:         false ->
  255:             [{socket_create_opts, [{inet_backend, socket}]} | Config]
  256:     end;
  257: init_per_group(local, Config) -> 
  258:     ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  259:        "is socket supported and is inet-backend = socket ?"),
  260:     case ?LIB:is_socket_supported() andalso ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
  261:         true ->
  262:             ?P("init_per_group(local) -> [socket] do we support 'local'?"),
  263:             case ?LIB:has_support_unix_domain_socket() of
  264:                 true ->
  265:                     ?P("init_per_group(local) -> [socket] which platform?"),
  266:                     case os:type() of
  267:                         {win32, _} ->
  268:                             %% AF_LOCAL (AF_UNIX) is *not* (yet) supported
  269:                             %% for DGRAM (UDP) 
  270:                             ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  271:                                "[socket,win32] 'local' not (currently) "
  272:                                "supported for DGRAM on windows"),
  273:                             {skip, "AF_LOCAL not supported"};
  274:                         {OSF, _} ->
  275:                             ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  276:                                "[socket,~w] we support (DGRAM) 'local'!",
  277:                                [OSF]),
  278:                             Config
  279:                     end;
  280:                 false ->
  281:                     {skip, "AF_LOCAL not supported"}
  282:             end;
  283:         false ->
  284:             ?P("init_per_group(local) -> [inet] do we support 'local'?"),
  285:             case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [local]) of
  286:                 {ok,S} ->
  287:                     ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  288:                        "[inet] we support (DGRAM) 'local'!"),
  289:                     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
  290:                     Config;
  291:                 {error, eafnosupport} ->
  292:                     ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  293:                        "[inet] we *do not* support 'local'"),
  294:                     {skip, "AF_LOCAL not supported"};
  295:                 {error, {invalid, {domain, local}}} ->
  296:                     ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  297:                        "[inet] we *do not* support 'local'"),
  298:                     {skip, "AF_LOCAL not supported"}
  299:             end
  300:     end;
  301: init_per_group(sockaddr = _GroupName, Config) ->
  302:     ?P("init_per_group(sockaddr) -> do we support 'socket'"),
  303:     try socket:info() of
  304: 	_ ->
  305:             ?P("init_per_group(sockaddr) -> we support 'socket'"),
  306:             Config
  307:     catch
  308:         error : notsup ->
  309:             ?P("init_per_group(sockaddr) -> we *do not* support 'socket'"),
  310:             {skip, "esock not supported"};
  311:         error : undef ->
  312:             ?P("init_per_group(sockaddr) -> 'socket' not configured"),
  313:             {skip, "esock not configured"}
  314:     end;
  315: init_per_group(otp18323 = _GroupName, Config) ->
  316:     ?P("init_per_group(otp18323) -> inet-drv specific bug(s)"),
  317:     case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
  318:         true ->
  319:             {skip, "Inet Drv specific bugs"};
  320:         false ->
  321:             ok
  322:     end;
  323: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  324:     Config.
  325: 
  326: end_per_group(local, _Config) ->
  327:     delete_local_filenames();
  328: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  329:     Config.
  330: 
  331: 
  332: init_per_testcase(Case, Config0) ->
  333:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> entry with"
  334:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  335:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  336:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  337:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  338:        [Config0, erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  339: 
  340:     kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:reset_events(),
  341: 
  342:     Config1 = init_per_testcase2(Case, Config0),
  343: 
  344:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> done when"
  345:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  346:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  347:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  348:     Config1.
  349: 
  350: init_per_testcase2(read_packets, Config) ->
  351:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
  352:     Config;
  353: init_per_testcase2(_Case, Config) ->
  354:     Config.
  355: 
  356: 
  357: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  358:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> entry with"
  359:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  360:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  361:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  362:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  363:        [Config, erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  364: 
  365:     ?P("system events during test: "
  366:        "~n   ~p", [kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:events()]),
  367: 
  368:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> done with"
  369:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  370:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  371:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  372:     ok.
  373: 
  374: 
  375: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  376: %% Send two packets to a closed port (on some systems this causes the socket
  377: %% to be closed).
  378: 
  379: %% Tests core functionality.
  380: send_to_closed(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  381:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_send_to_closed(Config) end).
  382: 
  383: do_send_to_closed(Config) ->
  384:     {ok, Sock} = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
  385:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
  386:     ok = gen_udp:send(Sock, Addr, ?CLOSED_PORT, "foo"),
  387:     timer:sleep(2),
  388:     ok = gen_udp:send(Sock, Addr, ?CLOSED_PORT, "foo"),
  389:     ok = gen_udp:close(Sock),
  390:     ok.
  391: 
  392: 
  393: 
  394: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  395: %% Send to the empty host name
  396: 
  397: send_to_empty(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  398:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_send_to_empty(Config) end).
  399: 
  400: do_send_to_empty(Config) ->
  401:     {ok, Sock} = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
  402:     element(1, os:type()) =:= unix andalso
  403:         begin
  404:             {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:send(Sock, "", ?CLOSED_PORT, "xXx"),
  405:             {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:send(Sock, '', ?CLOSED_PORT, "xXx")
  406:         end,
  407:     {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:send(Sock, ".", ?CLOSED_PORT, "xXx"),
  408:     {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:send(Sock, '.', ?CLOSED_PORT, "xXx"),
  409:     ok.
  410: 
  411: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  412: %% Test that the UDP socket buffer sizes are settable
  413: 
  414: %% Test UDP buffer size setting.
  415: buffer_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  416:     Cond = fun() ->
  417:                    case os:type() of
  418:                        {win32, nt} ->
  419:                            case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
  420:                                true ->
  421:                                    {skip, "TC not compliant with socket (yet)"};
  422:                                false ->
  423:                                    ok
  424:                            end;
  425:                        _ ->
  426:                            ok
  427:                    end
  428:            end,
  429:     TC   = fun() -> do_buffer_size(Config) end,
  430:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, TC).
  431: 
  432: do_buffer_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  433:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
  434:     ClientIP = Addr,
  435:     ServerIP = Addr,
  436:     Len = 256,
  437:     Bin = list_to_binary(lists:seq(0, Len-1)),
  438:     M = 8192 div Len,
  439:     SAFE = 3,
  440:     LONG = 1,
  441:     Spec0 =
  442: 	[
  443:          {opt, M},   {safe, M   - SAFE}, {long, M   + LONG},
  444: 	 {opt, 2*M}, {safe, 2*M - SAFE}, {long, 2*M + LONG},
  445: 	 {opt, 4*M}, {safe, 4*M - SAFE}, {long, 4*M + LONG}
  446:         ],
  447:     Spec =
  448: 	[case Tag of
  449: 	     opt ->
  450: 		 [{recbuf,Val*Len},{sndbuf,(Val + 2)*Len}];
  451: 	     safe ->
  452: 		 {list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(Val, Bin)),
  453: 		  [correct]};
  454: 	     long ->
  455: 		 {list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(Val, Bin)),
  456: 		  [truncated,emsgsize,timeout]}
  457: 	 end || {Tag,Val} <- Spec0],
  458:     %%
  459:     {ok, ClientSocket} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, ClientIP}]),
  460:     {ok, ClientPort}   = inet:port(ClientSocket),
  461:     Client = self(),
  462:     ?P("Client: {~p, ~p}, ~p", [ClientIP, ClientPort, ClientSocket]),
  463:     Server =
  464: 	spawn_link(
  465: 	  fun () ->
  466:                   ?P("buffer_size[server] -> starting"),
  467: 		  {ok, ServerSocket} =
  468:                       ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, ServerIP}]),
  469: 		  {ok, ServerPort}   =
  470:                       inet:port(ServerSocket),
  471: 		  Client ! {self(),port,ServerPort},
  472: 		  buffer_size_server(Client, ClientIP, ClientPort, 
  473: 				     ServerSocket, 1, Spec),
  474: 		  ok = gen_udp:close(ServerSocket)
  475: 	  end),
  476:     Mref = erlang:monitor(process, Server),
  477:     receive
  478: 	{Server, port, ServerPort} ->
  479:             ?P("Server: {~p, ~p}, ~p", [ServerIP, ServerPort, Server]),
  480: 	    buffer_size_client(Server, ServerIP, ServerPort,
  481: 			       ClientSocket, 1, Spec)
  482:     end,
  483:     ok = gen_udp:close(ClientSocket),
  484:     receive
  485: 	{'DOWN',Mref,_,_,normal} ->
  486: 	    ok
  487:     end.
  488: 
  489: buffer_size_client(_, _, _, _, _, []) ->
  490:     ok;
  491: buffer_size_client(Server, IP, Port, 
  492: 		   Socket, Cnt, [Opts|T]) when is_list(Opts) ->
  493:     ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> entry with"
  494:        "~n   Opts: ~p", [Cnt, Opts]),
  495:     ok = inet:setopts(Socket, Opts),
  496:     GOpts = [K || {K, _} <- Opts],
  497:     ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> options after set: "
  498:        "~n   ~p", [Cnt, inet:getopts(Socket, GOpts)]),
  499:     Server ! {self(),setopts,Cnt},
  500:     receive {Server,setopts,Cnt} -> ok end,
  501:     buffer_size_client(Server, IP, Port, Socket, Cnt+1, T);
  502: buffer_size_client(Server, IP, Port, 
  503: 		   Socket, Cnt, [{B,Replies}|T]=Opts) when is_binary(B) ->
  504:     ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> entry with"
  505:        "~n   send size:   ~w"
  506:        "~n   expecting:   ~p"
  507:        "~nwhen"
  508:        "~n   Socket Info: ~p",
  509:        [Cnt, byte_size(B), Replies, inet:info(Socket)]),
  510:     case gen_udp:send(Socket, IP, Port, <<Cnt,B/binary>>) of
  511: 	ok ->
  512: 	    receive
  513: 		{Server, Cnt, Reply} ->
  514:                     ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> "
  515:                        "~n   Reply: ~p", [Cnt, Reply]),
  516: 		    Tag =
  517:                         case Reply of
  518:                             %% {completion_status, #{info := Tag0}}
  519:                             %%   when is_atom(Tag0) ->
  520:                             %%     Tag0;
  521:                             %% {completion_status, Tag0} when is_atom(Tag0) ->
  522:                             %%     Tag0;
  523:                             {Tag0, _} ->
  524:                                 Tag0;
  525:                             Tag0 when is_atom(Tag0) ->
  526:                                 Tag0
  527:                         end,
  528: 		    case lists:member(Tag, Replies) of
  529: 			true -> ok;
  530: 			false ->
  531:                             ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> "
  532:                                "missing from expected replies: "
  533:                                "~n   Tag:     ~p"
  534:                                "~n   Replies: ~p", [Cnt, Tag, Replies]),
  535: 			    ct:fail({reply_mismatch,Cnt,Reply,Replies,
  536: 				     byte_size(B),
  537: 				     inet:getopts(Socket,
  538: 						  [sndbuf,recbuf])})
  539: 		    end,
  540: 		    buffer_size_client(Server, IP, Port, Socket, Cnt+1, T)
  541: 	    after 1313 ->
  542:                     %% ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> timeout", [Cnt]),
  543: 		    buffer_size_client(Server, IP, Port, Socket, Cnt, Opts)
  544: 	    end;
  545: 
  546: 	{error, enobufs = Reason} ->
  547: 	    ?P("<WARNING> send failed with '~w' - system overload => SKIP"),
  548: 	    ?SKIPE(Reason);
  549: 
  550: 	{error, Reason} ->
  551: 	    ?P("<ERROR> Client failed sending ~w bytes of data: "
  552: 	       "~n   SndBuf: ~p"
  553: 	       "~n   Reason: ~p",
  554: 	       [byte_size(B), inet:getopts(Socket, [sndbuf]), Reason]),
  555: 	    ct:fail(Reason)
  556:     end.
  557: 
  558: buffer_size_server(_, _, _, _, _, []) -> 
  559:     ok;
  560: buffer_size_server(Client, IP, Port, 
  561: 		   Socket, Cnt, [Opts|T]) when is_list(Opts) ->
  562:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> entry when await client setopts", [Cnt]),
  563:     receive {Client, setopts, Cnt} -> ok end,
  564:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> setopts with "
  565:        "~n   Opts:        ~p"
  566:        "~nwhen"
  567:        "~n   Socket info: ~p", [Cnt, Opts, inet:info(Socket)]),
  568:     ok = inet:setopts(Socket, Opts),
  569:     GOpts = [K || {K, _} <- Opts],
  570:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> options after set: "
  571:        "~n                ~p"
  572:        "~nwhen"
  573:        "~n   Socket info: ~p",
  574:        [Cnt, inet:getopts(Socket, GOpts), inet:info(Socket)]),
  575:     Client ! {self(), setopts, Cnt},
  576:     buffer_size_server(Client, IP, Port, Socket, Cnt+1, T);
  577: buffer_size_server(Client, IP, Port, 
  578: 		   Socket, Cnt, [{B,_}|T]) when is_binary(B) ->
  579:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> entry when"
  580:        "~n   expect ~w bytes of data"
  581:        "~nwhen"
  582:        "~n   Socket info: ~p"
  583:        "~n   MQ:          ~p", [Cnt, byte_size(B), inet:info(Socket), mq()]),
  584:     Reply = case buffer_size_server_recv(Socket, IP, Port, Cnt) of
  585:                 D when is_binary(D) ->
  586:                     SizeD = byte_size(D),
  587:                     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received: ~w bytes of data"
  588:                       "~nwhen"
  589:                        "~n   Socket Info: ~p", [Cnt, SizeD, inet:info(Socket)]),
  590:                     case B of
  591:                         D ->
  592:                             correct;
  593:                         <<D:SizeD/binary,_/binary>> ->
  594:                             truncated;
  595:                         _ ->
  596:                             {unexpected,D}
  597:                     end;
  598:                 Error ->
  599:                     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> error:"
  600:                        "~n                ~p"
  601:                        "~nwhen"
  602:                        "~n   Socket Info: ~p",
  603:                        [Cnt, Error, inet:info(Socket)]),
  604:                     Error
  605:             end,
  606:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> send reply '~p' when"
  607:        "~n   Socket Info: ~p", [Cnt, Reply, inet:info(Socket)]),
  608:     Client ! {self(), Cnt, Reply},
  609:     ?SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
  610:     buffer_size_server(Client, IP, Port, Socket, Cnt+1, T).
  611: 
  612: buffer_size_server_recv(Socket, IP, Port, Cnt) ->
  613:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> await data: "
  614:        "~n   Socket:      ~p"
  615:        "~n   IP:          ~p"
  616:        "~n   Port:        ~p"
  617:        "~nwhen"
  618:        "~n   Socket Info: ~p", [Cnt, Socket, IP, Port, inet:info(Socket)]),
  619:     receive
  620: 	{udp, Socket, IP, Port, <<Cnt, B/binary>>} ->
  621:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received ~w bytes",
  622:                [Cnt, byte_size(B)]),
  623: 	    B;
  624: 	{udp, Socket, IP, Port, <<_B/binary>>} ->
  625:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received unexpected ~w bytes",
  626:                [Cnt, byte_size(_B)]),
  627: 	    buffer_size_server_recv(Socket, IP, Port, Cnt);
  628: 
  629: 	{udp, Socket, IP, Port, _CRAP} ->
  630:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received unexpected crap", [Cnt]),
  631: 	    buffer_size_server_recv(Socket, IP, Port, Cnt);
  632: 
  633: 	{udp, XSocket, XIP, XPort, _CRAP} ->
  634:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received unexpected udp message: "
  635:                "~n   XSocket: ~p"
  636:                "~n   Socket:  ~p"
  637:                "~n   XIP:     ~p"
  638:                "~n   IP:      ~p"
  639:                "~n   XPort:   ~p"
  640:                "~n   Port:    ~p",
  641:                [Cnt, XSocket, Socket, XIP, IP, XPort, Port]),
  642: 	    buffer_size_server_recv(Socket, IP, Port, Cnt);
  643: 
  644: 	{udp_closed, Socket} ->
  645:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received unexpected 'closed'", [Cnt]),
  646: 	    closed;
  647: 
  648: 	{udp_error, Socket, Error} ->
  649:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> error: "
  650:                "~n   ~p", [Cnt, Error]),
  651:             ok = inet:setopts(Socket, [{active, true}]),
  652: 	    Error
  653: 
  654:     after 5000 ->
  655:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> timeout: "
  656:                "~n   Socket:       ~p"
  657:                "~n   Socket Info:  ~p"
  658:                "~n   Process Info: ~p",
  659:                [Cnt,
  660:                 Socket, inet:info(Socket), erlang:process_info(self())]),
  661: 	    {timeout, mq()}
  662:     end.
  663: 
  664: 
  665: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  666: %% OTP-15206: Keep buffer small for udp
  667: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  668: max_buffer_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  669:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_max_buffer_size(Config) end).
  670: 
  671: do_max_buffer_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  672:     ?P("create socket"),
  673:     {ok, Socket} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary]),
  674:     ?P("get buffers"),
  675:     {ok, [{recbuf, RecBuf0}, {buffer, Buffer0}]} =
  676:         inet:getopts(Socket, [recbuf, buffer]),
  677:     ?P("buffers: "
  678:        "~n   RecBuf: ~p"
  679:        "~n   Buffer: ~p", [RecBuf0, Buffer0]),
  680:     NewRecBuf = 1 bsl 20,
  681:     ?P("set recbuf: ~w", [NewRecBuf]),
  682:     ok = inet:setopts(Socket, [{recbuf, NewRecBuf}]),
  683:     ?P("get buffers"),
  684:     case inet:getopts(Socket, [recbuf, buffer]) of
  685:         {ok, [{recbuf, RecBuf}, {buffer, 65536 = Buffer}]} ->
  686:             ?P("buffers: expected"
  687:                "~n   RecBuf: ~p"
  688:                "~n   Buffer: ~p", [RecBuf, Buffer]),
  689:             gen_udp:close(Socket),
  690:             ok;
  691:         {ok, [{recbuf, RecBuf}, {buffer, Buffer}]} ->
  692:             ?P("buffers: unexpected"
  693:                "~n   RecBuf: ~p"
  694:                "~n   Buffer: ~p", [RecBuf, Buffer]),
  695:             gen_udp:close(Socket),
  696:             ct:fail({unexpected_buffer_size, Buffer});
  697:         {error, Reason} ->
  698:             ?P("failed extracting buffers"
  699:                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
  700:             (catch gen_udp:close(Socket)),
  701:             ct:fail({unexpected_getopts_error, Reason})
  702:     end,
  703:     ?P("done"),
  704:     ok.
  705:             
  706: 
  707: 
  708: 
  709: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  710: %% OTP-3823 gen_udp:recv does not return address in binary mode
  711: %%
  712: 
  713: %% OTP-3823 gen_udp:recv does not return address in binary mode.
  714: binary_passive_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  715:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_binary_passive_recv(Config) end).
  716: 
  717: do_binary_passive_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  718:     D1       = "The quick brown fox jumps over a lazy dog",
  719:     D2       = list_to_binary(D1),
  720:     D3       = ["The quick", <<" brown ">>, "fox jumps ", <<"over ">>,
  721: 		<<>>, $a, [[], " lazy ", <<"dog">>]],
  722:     D2       = iolist_to_binary(D3),
  723:     B        = D2,
  724:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
  725:     ?P("open receive socket"),
  726:     {ok, R}  = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary, {active, false}, {debug, true}]),
  727:     ok = inet:setopts(R, [{debug, false}]),
  728:     {ok, RP} = inet:port(R),
  729:     ?P("open send socket"),
  730:     {ok, S}  = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
  731:     {ok, SP} = inet:port(S),
  732:     ?P("try send (to port ~w) ~w bytes (as a list)", [RP, length(D1)]),
  733:     ok       = gen_udp:send(S, Addr, RP, D1),
  734:     ?P("try recv (from port ~w) ~w bytes", [SP, byte_size(B)+1]),
  735:     {ok, {Addr, SP, B}} = gen_udp:recv(R, byte_size(B)+1),
  736:     ?P("try send (to port ~w) ~w bytes (as a binary)", [RP, byte_size(D2)]),
  737:     ok       = gen_udp:send(S, Addr, RP, D2),
  738:     ?P("try recv (from port ~w) ~w bytes", [SP, byte_size(B)+1]),
  739:     {ok, {Addr, SP, B}} = gen_udp:recv(R, byte_size(B)+1),
  740:     ?P("try send (to port ~w) ~w bytes (as a iolist)", [RP, iolist_size(D3)]),
  741:     ok       = gen_udp:send(S, Addr, RP, D3),
  742:     ?P("try recv (from port ~w) ~w bytes", [SP, byte_size(B)+1]),
  743:     {ok, {Addr, SP, B}} = gen_udp:recv(R, byte_size(B)+1),
  744:     ?P("cleanup"),
  745:     ok       = gen_udp:close(S),
  746:     ok       = gen_udp:close(R),
  747:     ?P("done"),
  748:     ok.
  749: 
  750: 
  751: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  752: %% OTP-3836 inet_udp crashes when IP-address is larger than 255.
  753: 
  754: %% OTP-3836 inet_udp crashes when IP-address is larger than 255.
  755: bad_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  756:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_bad_address(Config) end).
  757: 
  758: do_bad_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  759:     ?P("create sockets"),
  760:     {ok, R}   = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
  761:     {ok, RP}  = inet:port(R),
  762:     {ok, S}   = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
  763:     {ok, _SP} = inet:port(S),
  764: 
  765:     ?P("try send to invalid address 1 - expect failure"),
  766:     case (catch gen_udp:send(S, {127,0,0,1,0}, RP, "void")) of
  767:         {'EXIT', badarg} ->
  768:             ok;
  769:         Any1 ->
  770:             ?P("<ERROR> unexpected result: "
  771:                "~n   ~p", [Any1]),
  772:             ct:fail({unexpected_result, 1, Any1})                
  773:     end,
  774: 
  775:     ?P("try send to invalid address 2 - expect failure"),
  776:     case (catch gen_udp:send(S, {127,0,0,256}, RP, "void")) of
  777:         {'EXIT', badarg} ->
  778:             ok;
  779:         Any2 ->
  780:             ?P("<ERROR> unexpected result: "
  781:                "~n   ~p", [Any2]),
  782:             ct:fail({unexpected_result, 2, Any2})
  783:     end,
  784: 
  785:     ?P("cleanup"),
  786:     ok       = gen_udp:close(S),
  787:     ok       = gen_udp:close(R),
  788: 
  789:     ?P("done"),
  790:     ok.
  791: 
  792: 
  793: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  794: %% OTP-6249 UDP option for number of packet reads
  795: %%
  796: %% Starts a node that on command sends a bunch of messages
  797: %% to our UDP port. The receiving process just receives and
  798: %% ignores the incoming messages.
  799: %% A tracing process traces the receiving port for
  800: %% 'send' and scheduling events. From the trace,
  801: %% how many messages are received per in/out scheduling,
  802: %% which should never be more than the read_packet parameter.
  803: 
  804: %% OTP-6249 UDP option for number of packet reads.
  805: read_packets(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  806:     Cond = fun() ->
  807: 		   case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
  808: 		       true ->
  809:                            %% We have not (yet) implemented support for 
  810:                            %% this option. We accept it but do not use it.
  811: 			   {skip, "Not compliant with socket"};
  812: 		       false ->
  813: 			   ok
  814: 		   end
  815: 	   end,
  816:     TC   = fun() ->
  817:                    ?P("~w:tc -> begin", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  818:                    Res = do_read_packets(Config),
  819:                    ?P("~w:tc -> done", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  820:                    Res
  821:            end,
  822:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, TC).
  823: 
  824: do_read_packets(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  825:     N1   = 5,
  826:     N2   = 1,
  827:     Msgs = 30000,
  828:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
  829:     ?P("open socket (with read-packets: ~p)", [N1]),
  830:     {ok, R}   = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {read_packets,N1}]),
  831:     {ok, {RA, RP}}  = inet:sockname(R),
  832:     ?P("reader: "
  833:        "~n   Addr: ~p"
  834:        "~n   Port: ~p", [RA, RP]),
  835: 
  836:     ?P("create slave node"),
  837:     {ok,Peer,Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  838:     %%
  839:     ?P("perform read-packets test"),
  840:     {V1, Trace1} = read_packets_test(Config, R, RA, RP, Msgs, Node),
  841:     ?P("verify read-packets (to ~w)", [N1]),
  842:     {ok,[{read_packets,N1}]} = inet:getopts(R, [read_packets]),
  843:     %%
  844:     ?P("set new read-packets: ~p", [N2]),
  845:     ok = inet:setopts(R, [{read_packets, N2}]),
  846:     ?P("perform read-packets test"),
  847:     {V2, Trace2} = read_packets_test(Config, R, RA, RP, Msgs, Node),
  848:     ?P("verify read-packets (to ~w)", [N2]),
  849:     {ok, [{read_packets,N2}]} = inet:getopts(R, [read_packets]),
  850:     %%
  851:     ?P("stop slave node"),
  852:     peer:stop(Peer),
  853:     ?P("dump trace 1"),
  854:     dump_terms(Config, "trace1.terms", Trace1),
  855:     ?P("dump trace 2"),
  856:     dump_terms(Config, "trace2.terms", Trace2),
  857: 
  858:     %% Because of the inherit racy-ness of the feature it is
  859:     %% hard to test that it behaves correctly.
  860:     %% Right now (OTP 21) a port task takes 5% of the
  861:     %% allotted port task reductions to execute, so
  862:     %% the max number of executions a port is allowed to
  863:     %% do before being re-scheduled is N * 20
  864: 
  865:     ?P("read-packets test verification when: "
  866:        "~n      N1: ~p"
  867:        "~n      V1: ~p"
  868:        "~n   vs"
  869:        "~n      N2: ~p"
  870:        "~n      V2: ~p", [N1, V1, N2, V2]),
  871:     if
  872:         V1 > (N1 * 20) ->
  873:             ct:fail("Got ~p msgs, max was ~p", [V1, N1]);
  874:         V2 > (N2 * 20) ->
  875:             ct:fail("Got ~p msgs, max was ~p", [V2, N2]);
  876:         true ->
  877:             ok
  878:     end,
  879:     ?P("done"),
  880:     ok.
  881: 
  882: dump_terms(Config, Name, Terms) ->
  883:     FName = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),Name),
  884:     file:write_file(FName, term_to_binary(Terms)),
  885:     ct:log("Logged terms to ~s",[FName]).
  886: 
  887: read_packets_test(Config, R, RA, RP, Msgs, Node) ->
  888:     Receiver = self(),
  889:     Tracer =
  890: 	spawn_link(
  891: 	  fun () ->
  892: 		  receive
  893: 		      {Receiver,get_trace} ->
  894: 			  Receiver ! {self(),{trace,flush()}}
  895: 		  end
  896: 	  end),
  897:     Sender =
  898: 	spawn_opt(
  899: 	  Node,
  900: 	  fun () ->
  901:                   %% We run on the same "machine" as R,
  902:                   %% so use the same addr
  903: 		  {ok, S}  = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, RA}]),
  904: 		  {ok, {SA, SP}} = inet:sockname(S),
  905: 		  Receiver ! {self(),{sockname, {SA, SP}}},
  906: 		  receive
  907: 		      {Receiver,go} ->
  908: 			  read_packets_send(S, RA, RP, Msgs)
  909: 		  end
  910: 	  end, 
  911: 	  [link,{priority,high}]),
  912:     receive
  913: 	{Sender, {sockname, {SA, SP}}} ->
  914: 	    erlang:trace(R, true,
  915: 			 [running_ports,'send',{tracer,Tracer}]),
  916: 	    erlang:yield(),
  917: 	    Sender ! {Receiver,go},
  918: 	    read_packets_recv(Msgs),
  919: 	    erlang:trace(R, false, [all]),
  920: 	    Tracer ! {Receiver,get_trace},
  921: 	    receive
  922: 		{Tracer,{trace,Trace}} ->
  923: 		    {read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace), Trace}
  924: 	    end
  925:     end.
  926: 
  927: read_packets_send(_S, _RA, _RP, 0) ->
  928:     ok;
  929: read_packets_send(S, RA, RP, Msgs) ->
  930:     ok = gen_udp:send(S, RA, RP, "UDP FLOOOOOOD"),
  931:     read_packets_send(S, RA, RP, Msgs - 1).
  932: 
  933: read_packets_recv(0) ->
  934:     ok;
  935: read_packets_recv(N) ->
  936:     receive
  937: 	_ ->
  938: 	    read_packets_recv(N - 1)
  939:     after 5000 ->
  940: 	    timeout
  941:     end.
  942: 
  943: read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace) ->
  944:     [Max | _] = Pkts =
  945:         lists:reverse(lists:sort(read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace, 0))),
  946:     ?P("read-packets verify: ~p", [lists:sublist(Pkts,10)]),
  947:     Max.
  948: 
  949: read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, [{trace,R,OutIn,_}|Trace], M) 
  950:   when OutIn =:= out; OutIn =:= in ->
  951:     push(M, read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace, 0));
  952: read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, [{trace, R,'receive',timeout}|Trace], M) ->
  953:     push(M, read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace, 0));
  954: read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP,
  955: 		    [{trace,R,'send',{udp, R, SA, SP,_Msg}, Self} | Trace], M)
  956:   when Self =:= self() ->
  957:     read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace, M+1);
  958: read_packets_verify(_R, _SA, _SP, [], M) ->
  959:     push(M, []);
  960: read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, [T | Trace], M) ->
  961:     ct:fail(
  962:       {read_packets_verify, mismatch, self(),
  963:        {R, SA, SP, [T, length(Trace)], M}});
  964: read_packets_verify(_R, _SA, _SP, Trace, M) ->
  965:     ct:fail({read_packets_verify,mismatch,Trace,M}).
  966: 
  967: push(0, Vs) ->
  968:     Vs;
  969: push(V, Vs) ->
  970:     [V|Vs].
  971: 
  972: flush() ->
  973:     receive
  974: 	X ->
  975: 	    [X|flush()]
  976:     after 200 ->
  977: 	    []
  978:     end.
  979: 
  980: 
  981: %% OTP-16059
  982: %% UDP recv with timeout 0 corrupts internal state so that after a
  983: %% recv under {active, once} the UDP recv poll wastes incoming data
  984: recv_poll_after_active_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  985:     Msg1 = <<"Hej!">>,
  986:     Msg2 = <<"Hej igen!">>,
  987:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
  988:     %% Addr = {127,0,0,1},
  989:     {ok,S1} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, Addr}, {active, once}]),
  990:     {ok,P1} = inet:port(S1),
  991:     {ok,S2} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, Addr}, {active, false}]),
  992:     {ok,P2} = inet:port(S2),
  993:     ok = gen_udp:send(S2, Addr, P1, Msg1),
  994:     receive
  995:         {udp, S1, Addr, P2, Msg1} ->
  996:             {error, timeout} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, 0),
  997:             ok = gen_udp:send(S2, Addr, P1, Msg2),
  998:             receive after 500 -> ok end, % Give the kernel time to deliver
  999:             {ok, {Addr, P2, Msg2}} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, 0),
 1000:             ok
 1001:     end.
 1002: 
 1003: 
 1004: %% Test that the 'fd' option works.
 1005: open_fd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1006:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1007:             fun() -> is_not_windows() end,
 1008:             fun() -> do_open_fd(Config) end).
 1009: 
 1010: do_open_fd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1011:     Msg = "Det gr ont nr knoppar brista. Varfr skulle annars vren tveka?",
 1012:     Addr = {127,0,0,1},
 1013:     ?P("try open first (default domain = inet) socket and get its fd"),
 1014:     {S1, FD} = case ?OPEN(Config, 0) of
 1015:                    {ok, Sock1} when is_port(Sock1) ->
 1016:                        {ok, FileDesc1} = prim_inet:getfd(Sock1),
 1017:                        {Sock1, FileDesc1};
 1018:                    {ok, Sock1} ->
 1019:                       {ok, [{fd, FileDesc1}]} =
 1020:                           gen_udp_socket:getopts(Sock1, [fd]),
 1021:                       {Sock1, FileDesc1}
 1022:                end,
 1023:     ?P("try get the socket port number"),
 1024:     {ok, P2} = inet:port(S1),
 1025: 
 1026:     ?P("try open second (domain = inet6) socket with FD = ~w "
 1027:        "and expect *failure*", [FD]),
 1028: 
 1029:     case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [inet6, {fd,FD}]) of
 1030:         {error, einval = Reason} ->
 1031:             ?P("expected failure reason ~w", [Reason]),
 1032:             ok;
 1033:         {error, eafnosupport = Reason} ->
 1034:             ?P("expected failure reason ~w (IPv6 not supported?)", [Reason]),
 1035:             ok;
 1036:         {error, Reason} ->
 1037:             ?P("unexpected failure: ~w", [Reason]),
 1038:             ct:fail({unexpected_failure, Reason});
 1039:         {ok, Socket} ->
 1040:             ?P("unexpected success: "
 1041:                "~n   ~p", [inet:info(Socket)]),
 1042:             (catch gen_udp:close(Socket)),
 1043:             (catch gen_udp:close(S1)),
 1044:             ct:fail(unexpected_succes)
 1045:     end,
 1046: 
 1047:     ?P("try open second socket with FD = ~w "
 1048:        "and expect success", [FD]),
 1049:     {ok, S2} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{fd, FD}]),
 1050:     {ok, P2} = inet:port(S2),
 1051: 
 1052:     ?P("try open third socket and expect success"),
 1053:     {ok, S3} = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
 1054:     {ok, P3} = inet:port(S3),
 1055: 
 1056:     ?P("try send message from socket 3 to socket 2 (~w)", [P2]),
 1057:     ok = gen_udp:send(S3, Addr, P2, Msg),
 1058:     receive
 1059: 	{udp, S2, Addr, P3, Msg} ->
 1060:             ?P("expected recv - "
 1061:                "try send message from socket 2 to socket 3 (~w)", [P3]),
 1062: 	    ok = gen_udp:send(S2, Addr, P3, Msg),
 1063: 	    receive
 1064: 		{udp, S3, Addr, P2, Msg} ->
 1065:                     ?P("expected recv - done"),
 1066: 		    ok
 1067: 	    after 1000 ->
 1068:                     ?P("unexpected timeout"),
 1069: 		    ct:fail(io_lib:format("~w", [flush()]))
 1070: 	    end
 1071:     after 1000 ->
 1072:             ?P("unexpected timeout"),
 1073: 	    ct:fail(io_lib:format("~w", [flush()]))
 1074:     end,
 1075:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1076:     (catch gen_udp:close(S3)),
 1077:     (catch gen_udp:close(S2)),
 1078:     (catch gen_udp:close(S1)),
 1079:     ?P("done"),
 1080:     ok.
 1081: 
 1082: active_n(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1083:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_active_n(Config) end).
 1084: 
 1085: do_active_n(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1086:     N = 3,
 1087:     ?P("create socket (1) with active = ~w", [N]),
 1088:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
 1089:     S1 = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {active,N}])),
 1090:     ?P("verify socket active = ~w (~p)", [N, which_info(S1)]),
 1091:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1092: 
 1093:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect passive", [-N]),
 1094:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,-N}]),
 1095:     receive
 1096:         {udp_passive, S1} ->
 1097:             ?P("expected passive received"),
 1098:             ok
 1099:     after
 1100:         5000 ->
 1101:             ?P("ERROR: passive *not* received"),
 1102:             exit({error,udp_passive_failure})
 1103:     end,
 1104:     ?P("verify socket active passive (=false) (~p)", [which_info(S1)]),
 1105:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1106: 
 1107:     ?P("set active = 0 and expect passive message"),
 1108:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active, 0}]),
 1109:     receive
 1110:         {udp_passive, S1} ->
 1111:             ?P("expected passive received"),
 1112:             ok
 1113:     after
 1114:         5000 ->
 1115:             ?P("ERROR: passive *not* received"),
 1116:             exit({error,udp_passive_failure})
 1117:     end,
 1118: 
 1119:     ?P("set active = 32767 (=max) and expect success"),
 1120:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,32767}]),
 1121:     ?P("try set active = 1 (already at max) and expect failure (einval)"),
 1122:     {error, einval} = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,1}]),
 1123:     ?P("set active = -32769 (<min) and expect failure (einval)"),
 1124:     {error, einval} = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,-32769}]),
 1125:     ?P("set active = -32768 and expect passive message"),
 1126:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,-32768}]),
 1127:     receive
 1128:         {udp_passive, S1} ->
 1129:             ?P("expected passive received"),
 1130:             ok
 1131:     after
 1132:         5000 ->
 1133:             ?P("ERROR: passive *not* received"),
 1134:             exit({error,udp_passive_failure})
 1135:     end,
 1136: 
 1137:     ?P("verify socket active passive (=false), (~p)", [which_info(S1)]),
 1138:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1139:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect success", [N]),
 1140:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,N}]),
 1141:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect success", [true]),
 1142:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,true}]),
 1143:     ?P("verify socket active active (=true) (~p)", [which_info(S1)]),
 1144:     [{active,true}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1145:     ?P("verify nothing in the message queue"),
 1146:     receive
 1147:         Unexpected_1 ->
 1148:             ?P("ERROR: something in the message queue: "
 1149:                "~n   ~p", [Unexpected_1]),
 1150:             exit({error, active_n, Unexpected_1})
 1151:     after
 1152:         0 ->
 1153:             ?P("nothing in the message queue"),
 1154:             ok
 1155:     end,
 1156: 
 1157:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect success", [N]),
 1158:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,N}]),
 1159:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect success", [once]),
 1160:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,once}]),
 1161:     ?P("verify socket active active (=once) (~p)", [which_info(S1)]),
 1162:     [{active,once}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1163:     receive
 1164:         Unexpected_2 ->
 1165:             ?P("ERROR: something in the message queue: "
 1166:                "~n   ~p", [Unexpected_2]),
 1167:             exit({error,active_n, Unexpected_2})
 1168:     after
 1169:         0 ->
 1170:             ?P("nothing in the message queue"),
 1171:             ok
 1172:     end,
 1173: 
 1174:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect failure (einval)", [32768]),
 1175:     {error,einval} = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,32768}]),
 1176:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect success", [false]),
 1177:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,false}]),
 1178:     ?P("verify socket active passive (=false) (~p)", [which_info(S1)]),
 1179:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1180: 
 1181:      %% S1Port = ok(inet:port(S1)),
 1182:     {S1Addr, S1Port} = ok(inet:sockname(S1)),
 1183:     ?P("S1 sockname: "
 1184:        "~n   Addr: ~p"
 1185:        "~n   Port: ~p", [S1Addr, S1Port]),
 1186: 
 1187:     ?P("create socket (2) with active = ~w", [N]),
 1188:     S2 = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {active,N}])),
 1189: 
 1190:     %% S2Port = ok(inet:port(S2)),
 1191:     {S2Addr, S2Port} = ok(inet:sockname(S2)),
 1192:     ?P("S2 sockname: "
 1193:        "~n   Addr: ~p"
 1194:        "~n   Port: ~p", [S2Addr, S2Port]),
 1195: 
 1196:     ?P("verify socket (2) active = ~w (~p)", [N, which_info(S2)]),
 1197:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(S2, [active])),
 1198:     ?P("set socket (1) active = ~w and expect success", [N]),
 1199:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,N}]),
 1200:     ?P("verify socket (1) active = ~w (~p)", [N, which_info(S1)]),
 1201:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1202:     ?P("generate ~w message(s) and send them: S1 -> S2 and S2 -> S1 when:"
 1203:        "~n   Socket 1 info: ~p"
 1204:        "~n   Socket 2 info: ~p", [N, inet:info(S1), inet:info(S2)]),
 1205:     lists:foreach(
 1206:       fun(I) ->
 1207:               Msg = "message "++integer_to_list(I),
 1208:               ?P("send message ~w from S2 to S1 (~p, ~w):"
 1209:                  "~n   S1 info: ~p"
 1210:                  "~n   S2 info: ~p",
 1211:                  [I, S1Addr, S1Port, inet:info(S1), inet:info(S2)]),
 1212:               case gen_udp:send(S2, S1Addr, S1Port, Msg) of
 1213:                   ok ->
 1214:                       ok;
 1215:                   {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 1216:                       ?P("Failed sending message ~w: "
 1217:                          "~n   ~p", [N, Reason]),
 1218:                       exit(ERROR)
 1219:               end,
 1220:               ?P("expect message on S1"),
 1221:               receive
 1222:                   {udp, S1, _, S2Port, Msg} ->
 1223:                       ?P("expected message received on S1 - "
 1224:                          "send message back: from S1 to S2 (~p, ~w): "
 1225:                          "~n   ~p", [S2Addr, S2Port, inet:info(S1)]),
 1226:                       ok = gen_udp:send(S1, S2Addr, S2Port, Msg)
 1227:               after
 1228:                   5000 ->
 1229:                       ?P("ERROR: received nothing (->S1)"),
 1230:                       exit({error,timeout})
 1231:               end,
 1232:               ?P("expect message on S2"),
 1233:               receive
 1234:                   {udp, S2, _, S1Port, Msg} ->
 1235:                       ?P("expected message received on S2: "
 1236:                          "~n   ~p", [inet:info(S2)]),
 1237:                       ok
 1238:               after
 1239:                   5000 ->
 1240:                       ?P("ERROR: received nothing (->S2)"),
 1241:                       exit({error,timeout})
 1242:               end
 1243:       end, lists:seq(1,N)),
 1244:     ?P("expect passive message for socket (1)"),
 1245:     receive
 1246:         {udp_passive, S1} ->
 1247:             ?P("received passive message for socket (1) - "
 1248:                "verify socket active passive (false)"),
 1249:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active]))
 1250:     after
 1251:         5000 ->
 1252:             ?P("ERROR: received nothing (1)"),
 1253:             exit({error,udp_passive})
 1254:     end,
 1255:     ?P("expect passive message for socket (2)"),
 1256:     receive
 1257:         {udp_passive,S2} ->
 1258:             ?P("received passive message for socket (2) - "
 1259:                "verify socket active passive (false)"),
 1260:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S2, [active]))
 1261:     after
 1262:         5000 ->
 1263:             ?P("ERROR: received nothing (2)"),
 1264:             exit({error,udp_passive})
 1265:     end,
 1266: 
 1267:     ?P("create socket (3) with active = ~w and expect passive message", [0]),
 1268:     S3 = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {active,0}])),
 1269:     receive
 1270:         {udp_passive,S3} ->
 1271:             ?P("received passive message for socket (3) - "
 1272:                "verify socket active passive (false)"),
 1273:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S3, [active]))
 1274:     after
 1275:         5000 ->
 1276:             ?P("ERROR: received nothing (3)"),
 1277:             exit({error,udp_passive})
 1278:     end,
 1279: 
 1280:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1281:     ok = gen_udp:close(S3),
 1282:     ok = gen_udp:close(S2),
 1283:     ok = gen_udp:close(S1),
 1284: 
 1285:     ?P("done"),
 1286:     ok.
 1287: 
 1288: 
 1289: 
 1290: recvtos(Config) ->
 1291:     test_recv_opts(
 1292:       Config,
 1293:       inet, [{recvtos,tos,96}], false,
 1294:       fun recvtos_ok/2).
 1295: 
 1296: recvtosttl(Config) ->
 1297:     test_recv_opts(
 1298:       Config,
 1299:       inet, [{recvtos,tos,96},{recvttl,ttl,33}], false,
 1300:       fun (OSType, OSVer) ->
 1301:               recvtos_ok(OSType, OSVer) andalso recvttl_ok(OSType, OSVer)
 1302:       end).
 1303: 
 1304: recvttl(Config) ->
 1305:     test_recv_opts(
 1306:       Config,
 1307:       inet, [{recvttl,ttl,33}], false,
 1308:       fun recvttl_ok/2).
 1309: 
 1310: recvtclass(Config) ->
 1311:     {ok,IFs} = inet:getifaddrs(),
 1312:     case
 1313:         [Name ||
 1314:             {Name,Opts} <- IFs,
 1315:             lists:member({addr,{0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1}}, Opts)]
 1316:     of
 1317:         [_] ->
 1318:             test_recv_opts(
 1319:               Config,
 1320:               inet6, [{recvtclass,tclass,224}], false,
 1321:               fun recvtclass_ok/2);
 1322:         [] ->
 1323:             {skip,ipv6_not_supported,IFs}
 1324:     end.
 1325: 
 1326: 
 1327: sendtos(Config) ->
 1328:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_sendtos(Config) end).
 1329: 
 1330: do_sendtos(Config) ->
 1331:     test_recv_opts(
 1332:       Config,
 1333:       inet, [{recvtos,tos,96}], true,
 1334:       fun sendtos_ok/2).
 1335: 
 1336: sendtosttl(Config) ->
 1337:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_sendtosttl(Config) end).
 1338: 
 1339: do_sendtosttl(Config) ->
 1340:     test_recv_opts(
 1341:       Config,
 1342:       inet, [{recvtos,tos,96},{recvttl,ttl,33}], true,
 1343:       fun (OSType, OSVer) ->
 1344:               sendtos_ok(OSType, OSVer) andalso sendttl_ok(OSType, OSVer)
 1345:       end).
 1346: 
 1347: sendttl(Config) ->
 1348:     ?TC_TRY(sendttl, fun() -> do_sendttl(Config) end).
 1349: 
 1350: do_sendttl(Config) ->
 1351:     test_recv_opts(
 1352:       Config,
 1353:       inet, [{recvttl,ttl,33}], true,
 1354:       fun sendttl_ok/2).
 1355: 
 1356: sendtclass(Config) ->
 1357:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_sendtclass(Config) end).
 1358: 
 1359: do_sendtclass(Config) ->
 1360:     {ok,IFs} = inet:getifaddrs(),
 1361:     case
 1362:         [Name ||
 1363:             {Name,Opts} <- IFs,
 1364:             lists:member({addr,{0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1}}, Opts)]
 1365:     of
 1366:         [_] ->
 1367:             test_recv_opts(
 1368:               Config,
 1369:               inet6, [{recvtclass,tclass,224}], true,
 1370:               fun sendtclass_ok/2);
 1371:         [] ->
 1372:             {skip, {ipv6_not_supported, IFs}}
 1373:     end.
 1374: 
 1375: 
 1376: %% These version numbers are just above the highest noted in daily tests
 1377: %% where the test fails for a plausible reason, that is the lowest
 1378: %% where we can expect that the test might succeed, so
 1379: %% skip on platforms lower than this.
 1380: %%
 1381: %% On newer versions it might be fixed, but we'll see about that
 1382: %% when machines with newer versions gets installed...
 1383: %% If the test still fails for a plausible reason these
 1384: %% version numbers simply should be increased.
 1385: %% Or maybe we should change to only test on known good platforms?
 1386: 
 1387: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1388: recvtos_ok({unix,darwin}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {17,6,0});
 1389: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1390: recvtos_ok({unix,openbsd}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {6,9,0});
 1391: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1392: recvtos_ok({unix,netbsd}, _OSVer) -> false;
 1393: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1394: recvtos_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1395: %%
 1396: recvtos_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1397: recvtos_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1398: 
 1399: %% Option has no effect
 1400: recvttl_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1401: %%
 1402: recvttl_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1403: recvttl_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1404: 
 1405: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1406: recvtclass_ok({unix,darwin}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {9,9,0});
 1407: recvtclass_ok({unix,linux}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {2,6,11});
 1408: %% Option has no effect
 1409: recvtclass_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1410: %%
 1411: recvtclass_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1412: recvtclass_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1413: 
 1414: 
 1415: %% To send ancillary data seems to require much higher version numbers
 1416: %% than receiving it...
 1417: %%
 1418: 
 1419: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1420: sendtos_ok({unix,darwin}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {19,0,0});
 1421: sendtos_ok({unix,netbsd}, _OSVer) -> false;
 1422: sendtos_ok({unix,openbsd}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {6,9,0});
 1423: sendtos_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1424: sendtos_ok({unix,linux}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {4,0,0});
 1425: sendtos_ok({unix,freebsd}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {13,1,0});
 1426: %%
 1427: sendtos_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1428: sendtos_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1429: 
 1430: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1431: sendttl_ok({unix,darwin}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {19,6,0});
 1432: sendttl_ok({unix,linux}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {4,0,0});
 1433: %% Using the option returns enoprotoopt, so it is not implemented.
 1434: sendttl_ok({unix,freebsd}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {13,1,0});
 1435: %% Option has no effect
 1436: sendttl_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1437: sendttl_ok({unix,openbsd}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {6,9,0});
 1438: %%
 1439: sendttl_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1440: sendttl_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1441: 
 1442: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1443: sendtclass_ok({unix,darwin}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {9,9,0});
 1444: sendtclass_ok({unix,linux}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {2,6,11});
 1445: %% Option has no effect
 1446: sendtclass_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1447: %%
 1448: sendtclass_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1449: sendtclass_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1450: 
 1451: 
 1452: semver_lt({X1,Y1,Z1} = V1, {X2,Y2,Z2} = V2) ->
 1453:     ?P("semver_lt -> OS version check:"
 1454:        "~n   Version 1: ~p"
 1455:        "~n   Version 2: ~p", [V1, V2]),
 1456:     if
 1457:         X1 > X2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> X1 > X2: ~p > ~p", [X1, X2]), false;
 1458:         X1 < X2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> X1 < X2: ~p < ~p", [X1, X2]), true;
 1459:         Y1 > Y2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> Y1 > Y2: ~p > ~p", [Y1, Y2]), false;
 1460:         Y1 < Y2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> Y1 < Y2: ~p < ~p", [Y1, Y2]), true;
 1461:         Z1 > Z2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> Z1 > Z2: ~p > ~p", [Z1, Z2]), false;
 1462:         Z1 < Z2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> Z1 < Z2: ~p < ~p", [Z1, Z2]), true;
 1463:         true    -> ?P("semver_lt -> default"), false
 1464:     end;
 1465: semver_lt(V1, {_,_,_} = V2) ->
 1466:     ?P("semver_lt -> fallback OS version check when: "
 1467:        "~n   Version 1: ~p"
 1468:        "~n   Version 2: ~p", [V1, V2]),
 1469:     false.
 1470: 
 1471: test_recv_opts(Config, Family, Spec, TestSend, OSFilter) ->
 1472:     OSType = os:type(),
 1473:     OSVer  = os:version(),
 1474:     case OSFilter(OSType, OSVer) of
 1475:         true ->
 1476:             ?P("OS: ~p, ~p", [OSType, OSVer]),
 1477:             test_recv_opts(Config,
 1478:                            Family, Spec, TestSend, OSType, OSVer);
 1479:         false ->
 1480:             {skip,{not_supported_for_os_version,{OSType,OSVer}}}
 1481:     end.
 1482: %%
 1483: test_recv_opts(Config, Family, Spec, TestSend, _OSType, _OSVer) ->
 1484:     Timeout = 5000,
 1485:     RecvOpts = [RecvOpt || {RecvOpt,_,_} <- Spec],
 1486:     TrueRecvOpts = [{RecvOpt,true} || {RecvOpt,_,_} <- Spec],
 1487:     FalseRecvOpts = [{RecvOpt,false} || {RecvOpt,_,_} <- Spec],
 1488:     Opts = [Opt || {_,Opt,_} <- Spec],
 1489:     OptsVals = [{Opt,Val} || {_,Opt,Val} <- Spec],
 1490:     TrueRecvOpts_OptsVals = TrueRecvOpts ++ OptsVals,
 1491:     Addr =
 1492:         case Family of
 1493:             inet ->
 1494:                 {127,0,0,1};
 1495:             inet6 ->
 1496:                 {0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1}
 1497:         end,
 1498:     %%
 1499:     ?P("try open socket (1) with true opts"),
 1500:     {ok, S1} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [Family, binary, {active,false}|TrueRecvOpts]),
 1501:     {ok, P1} = inet:port(S1),
 1502:     ?P("try get (true) socket (1) opts"),
 1503:     {ok, TrueRecvOpts} = inet:getopts(S1, RecvOpts),
 1504:     ?P("try set (false) socket (1) opts"),
 1505:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, FalseRecvOpts),
 1506:     ?P("verify (false) socket (1) opts"),
 1507:     {ok, FalseRecvOpts} = inet:getopts(S1, RecvOpts),
 1508:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, TrueRecvOpts_OptsVals),
 1509:     {ok,TrueRecvOpts_OptsVals} = inet:getopts(S1, RecvOpts ++ Opts),
 1510:     %%
 1511:     %% S1 now has true receive options and set option values
 1512:     %%
 1513:     ?P("try open socket (2) with false opts"),
 1514:     {ok, S2} =
 1515:         ?OPEN(Config, 0, [Family, binary, {active,true} | FalseRecvOpts]),
 1516:     {ok, P2} = inet:port(S2),
 1517:     ?P("try get (false) socket (2) opts"),
 1518:     {ok, FalseRecvOpts_OptsVals2} = inet:getopts(S2, RecvOpts ++ Opts),
 1519:     OptsVals2 = FalseRecvOpts_OptsVals2 -- FalseRecvOpts,
 1520:     ?P("info: "
 1521:        "~n   Socket 1:    ~p"
 1522:        "~n   Socket 2:    ~p"
 1523:        "~n   Opts Vals 2: ~p", [inet:info(S1), inet:info(S2), OptsVals2]),
 1524: 
 1525:     %%
 1526:     %% S2 now has false receive options and default option values,
 1527:     %% OptsVals2 contains the default option values
 1528:     %%
 1529:     ?P("send/3: S2 -> S1"),
 1530:     ok = gen_udp:send(S2, {Addr,P1}, <<"abcde">>),
 1531:     ?SLEEP(100),
 1532: 
 1533:     ?P("send/4: S1 -> S2"),
 1534:     ok = gen_udp:send(S1, Addr, P2, <<"fghij">>),
 1535:     TestSend andalso
 1536:         begin
 1537:             ?P("send/5: S2 -> S1"
 1538:                "~n   ~p", [OptsVals]),
 1539:             case gen_udp:send(S2, Addr, P1, OptsVals, <<"ABCDE">>) of
 1540:                 ok ->
 1541:                     ?SLEEP(100),
 1542:                     ok;
 1543:                 {error, enoprotoopt = Reason1} ->
 1544:                     ?SKIPT(?F("send (1) failed: ~p", [Reason1]))
 1545:             end,
 1546:             ?P("send/4: S2 -> S1"
 1547:                "~n   ~p", [OptsVals]),
 1548:             case gen_udp:send(S2, {Addr,P1}, OptsVals, <<"12345">>) of
 1549:                 ok ->
 1550:                     ?SLEEP(100),
 1551:                     ok;
 1552:                 {error, enoprotoopt = Reason2} ->
 1553:                     ?SKIPT(?F("send (2) failed: ~p", [Reason2]))
 1554:             end
 1555:         end,
 1556:     ?P("try S1 recv"),
 1557:     {ok,{_,P2,OptsVals3, <<"abcde">>}} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, Timeout),
 1558:     ?P("S1 recv: "
 1559:        "~n   OptsVals3: ~p", [OptsVals3]),
 1560:     ?SLEEP(100),
 1561: 
 1562:     verify_sets_eq(OptsVals3, OptsVals2),
 1563:     TestSend andalso
 1564:         begin
 1565:             ?P("try S1 recv"),
 1566:             {ok,{_,P2,OptsVals0,<<"ABCDE">>}} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, Timeout),
 1567:             ?P("S1 recv: "
 1568:                "~n   OptsVals0: ~p", [OptsVals0]),
 1569:             ?SLEEP(100),
 1570: 
 1571:             ?P("try S1 recv"),
 1572:             {ok,{_,P2,OptsVals1,<<"12345">>}} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, Timeout),
 1573:             ?P("S1 recv: "
 1574:                "~n   OptsVals1: ~p", [OptsVals1]),
 1575:             ?SLEEP(100),
 1576:             verify_sets_eq(OptsVals0, OptsVals),
 1577:             verify_sets_eq(OptsVals1, OptsVals)
 1578:         end,
 1579:     ?P("await message on S2"),
 1580:     receive
 1581:         {udp, S2, _, P1, <<"fghij">>} ->
 1582:             ?P("S2 received message"),
 1583:             ok;
 1584:         Other1 ->
 1585:             exit({unexpected,Other1})
 1586:     after Timeout ->
 1587:             exit(timeout)
 1588:     end,
 1589:     %%
 1590:     ?P("try set (false) socket (1) opts"),
 1591:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, FalseRecvOpts),
 1592:     ?P("verify (false) socket (1) opts"),
 1593:     {ok, FalseRecvOpts} = inet:getopts(S1, RecvOpts),
 1594:     ?P("try set (true) socket (1) opts"),
 1595:     ok = inet:setopts(S2, TrueRecvOpts),
 1596:     ?P("verify (true) socket (1) opts"),
 1597:     {ok,TrueRecvOpts} = inet:getopts(S2, RecvOpts),
 1598:     %%
 1599:     %% S1 now has false receive options and set option values
 1600:     %%
 1601:     %% S2 now has true receive options and default option values
 1602:     %%
 1603:     ?P("send/4: S2 -> S1"),
 1604:     ok = gen_udp:send(S2, {Addr,P1}, [], <<"klmno">>),
 1605:     ?SLEEP(100),
 1606: 
 1607:     ?P("send/3: S1 -> S2"),
 1608:     ok = gen_udp:send(S1, {Family,{loopback,P2}}, <<"pqrst">>),
 1609:     ?SLEEP(100),
 1610: 
 1611:     TestSend andalso
 1612:         begin
 1613:             ?P("send/4: S1 -> S2"
 1614:                "~n   ~p", [OptsVals]),
 1615:             ok = gen_udp:send(S1,
 1616:                               {Family,{loopback,P2}}, OptsVals2, <<"PQRST">>),
 1617:             ?SLEEP(100)
 1618:         end,
 1619: 
 1620:     ?P("try recv data on S1"),
 1621:     {ok,{_,P2,<<"klmno">>}} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, Timeout),
 1622:     ?P("await message on S2"),
 1623:     receive
 1624:         {udp,S2,_,P1,OptsVals4,<<"pqrst">>} ->
 1625:             ?P("S2 message received: "
 1626:                "~n   OptsVals4: ~p", [OptsVals4]),
 1627:             verify_sets_eq(OptsVals4, OptsVals);
 1628:         Other2 ->
 1629:             exit({unexpected,Other2})
 1630:     after Timeout ->
 1631:             exit(timeout)
 1632:     end,
 1633:     ?P("(maybe, ~p) await message on S2", [TestSend]),
 1634:     TestSend andalso
 1635:         receive
 1636:             {udp, S2, _, P1, OptsVals5, <<"PQRST">>} ->
 1637:                 ?P("S2 message received: "
 1638:                    "~n   OptsVals5: ~p", [OptsVals5]),
 1639:                 verify_sets_eq(OptsVals5, OptsVals2);
 1640:             Other3 ->
 1641:                 exit({unexpected,Other3})
 1642:         after Timeout ->
 1643:                 exit(timeout)
 1644:         end,
 1645: 
 1646:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1647:     ok = gen_udp:close(S1),
 1648:     ok = gen_udp:close(S2),
 1649: %%%    exit({{_OSType,_OSVer},success}), % In search for the truth
 1650: 
 1651:     ?P("done"),
 1652:     ok.
 1653: 
 1654: verify_sets_eq(L1, L2) ->
 1655:     L = lists:sort(L1),
 1656:     case lists:sort(L2) of
 1657:         L ->
 1658:             ok;
 1659:         _ ->
 1660:             exit({sets_neq, L1, L2})
 1661:     end.
 1662: 
 1663: 
 1664: local_basic(Config) ->
 1665:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_local_basic(Config, []) end).
 1666: 
 1667: local_basic_binary(Config) ->
 1668:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_local_basic(Config, [binary]) end).
 1669: 
 1670: do_local_basic(Config, Opts) ->
 1671:     ?P("begin"),
 1672:     SFile = local_filename(server),
 1673:     SAddr = {local,bin_filename(SFile)},
 1674:     CFile = local_filename(client),
 1675:     CAddr = {local,bin_filename(CFile)},
 1676:     _ = file:delete(SFile),
 1677:     _ = file:delete(CFile),
 1678:     %%
 1679:     ?P("create server socket"),
 1680:     S = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,{local,SFile}},{active,false}|Opts])),
 1681:     ?P("create client socket"),
 1682:     C = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,{local,CFile}},{active,false}|Opts])),
 1683:     SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S)),
 1684:     CAddr = ok(inet:sockname(C)),
 1685:     ?P("SockName(s):"
 1686:        "~n   Server: ~p"
 1687:        "~n   Client: ~p", [SAddr, CAddr]),
 1688:     local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, CAddr),
 1689: 
 1690:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1691:     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 1692:     ok = gen_udp:close(C),
 1693:     %%
 1694:     ok = file:delete(SFile),
 1695:     ok = file:delete(CFile),
 1696:     ?P("end"),
 1697:     ok.
 1698: 
 1699: local_unbound(Config) ->
 1700:     SFile = local_filename(server),
 1701:     SAddr = {local,bin_filename(SFile)},
 1702:     _ = file:delete(SFile),
 1703:     %%
 1704:     S = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,SAddr},{active,false}])),
 1705:     C = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [local,{active,false}])),
 1706:     SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S)),
 1707:     local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, undefined),
 1708:     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 1709:     ok = gen_udp:close(C),
 1710:     %%
 1711:     ok = file:delete(SFile),
 1712:     ok.
 1713: 
 1714: local_fdopen(Config) ->
 1715:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_local_fdopen(Config) end).
 1716: 
 1717: 
 1718: do_local_fdopen(Config) ->
 1719:     ?P("begin"),
 1720:     SFile = local_filename(server),
 1721:     SAddr = {local,bin_filename(SFile)},
 1722:     CFile = local_filename(client),
 1723:     CAddr = {local,bin_filename(CFile)},
 1724:     _ = file:delete(SFile),
 1725:     _ = file:delete(CFile),
 1726: 
 1727:     %%
 1728:     ?P("try create \"dummy\" (server) socket"),
 1729:     {S0, FD} = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,SAddr},{active,false}]) of
 1730:                    {ok, Sock0} when is_port(Sock0) ->
 1731:                        ?P("(port) try extract FD"),
 1732:                        Fd = ok(prim_inet:getfd(Sock0)),
 1733:                        {Sock0, Fd};
 1734:                    {ok, Sock0} -> % socket
 1735:                        ?P("(socket) try extract FD"),
 1736:                        {ok, [{fd, Fd}]} =
 1737:                            gen_udp_socket:getopts(Sock0, [fd]),
 1738:                        {Sock0, Fd}
 1739:                end,
 1740:     ?P("try create (client) socket"),
 1741:     C  = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,{local,CFile}},{active,false}])),
 1742:     SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S0)),
 1743:     CAddr = ok(inet:sockname(C)),
 1744:     ?P("try create (server) socket using fd = ~w", [FD]),
 1745:     S  = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{fd, FD}, local, {active,false}])),
 1746:     SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S)),
 1747: 
 1748:     ?P("perform handshake"),
 1749:     local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, CAddr),
 1750: 
 1751:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1752:     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 1753:     ok = gen_udp:close(S0),
 1754:     ok = gen_udp:close(C),
 1755:     %%
 1756:     ok = file:delete(SFile),
 1757:     ok = file:delete(CFile),
 1758:     ?P("done"),
 1759:     ok.
 1760: 
 1761: local_fdopen_unbound(Config) ->
 1762:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_local_fdopen_unbound(Config) end).
 1763: 
 1764: do_local_fdopen_unbound(Config) ->
 1765:     ?P("begin"),
 1766:     SFile = local_filename(server),
 1767:     SAddr = {local,bin_filename(SFile)},
 1768:     _ = file:delete(SFile),
 1769: 
 1770:     %%
 1771:     ?P("try create (server) socket"),
 1772:     S  = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,SAddr},{active,false}])),
 1773:     ?P("try create \"dummy\" (client) socket"),
 1774:     {C0, FD} = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [local,{active,false}]) of
 1775:                    {ok, Sock0} when is_port(Sock0) ->
 1776:                        ?P("(port) try extract FD"),
 1777:                        Fd = ok(prim_inet:getfd(Sock0)),
 1778:                        {Sock0, Fd};
 1779:                    {ok, Sock0} -> % socket
 1780:                        ?P("(socket) try extract FD"),
 1781:                        {ok, [{fd, Fd}]} =
 1782:                            gen_udp_socket:getopts(Sock0, [fd]),
 1783:                        {Sock0, Fd}
 1784:                end,
 1785:     SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S)),
 1786:     ?P("try create (client) socket using fd = ~w", [FD]),
 1787:     C  = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{fd,Fd},local,{active,false}])),
 1788: 
 1789:     ?P("perform handshake"),
 1790:     local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, undefined),
 1791: 
 1792:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1793:     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 1794:     ok = gen_udp:close(C),
 1795:     ok = gen_udp:close(C0),
 1796:     %%
 1797:     ok = file:delete(SFile),
 1798: 
 1799:     ?P("done"),
 1800:     ok.
 1801: 
 1802: local_abstract(Config) ->
 1803:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_local_abstract(Config) end).
 1804: 
 1805: do_local_abstract(Config) ->
 1806:     case os:type() of
 1807: 	{unix,linux} ->
 1808:             ?P("create server socket"),
 1809: 	    S = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,{local,<<>>}},{active,false}])),
 1810:             ?P("create client socket"),
 1811: 	    C = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,{local,<<>>}},{active,false}])),
 1812:             ?P("verify sockname(s)"),
 1813: 	    {local,_} = SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S)),
 1814: 	    {local,_} = CAddr = ok(inet:sockname(C)),
 1815:             ?P("perform handshake"),
 1816: 	    local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, CAddr),
 1817:             ?P("cleanup"),
 1818: 	    ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 1819: 	    ok = gen_udp:close(C),
 1820:             ?P("done"),
 1821: 	    ok;
 1822: 	_ ->
 1823: 	    {skip, "AF_LOCAL Abstract Addresses only supported on Linux"}
 1824:     end.
 1825: 
 1826: 
 1827: local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, CAddr) ->
 1828:     SData = "9876543210",
 1829:     CData = "0123456789",
 1830:     ?P("try (client) send"),
 1831:     ok = gen_udp:send(C, SAddr, 0, CData),
 1832:     ?P("try (server) recv"),
 1833:     CData1 = local_handshake_data(C, CData),
 1834:     case ok(gen_tcp:recv(S, 112)) of
 1835: 	{{unspec,<<>>}, 0, CData1} when CAddr =:= undefined ->
 1836: 	    ok;
 1837: 	{{local,<<>>}, 0, CData1} when CAddr =:= undefined ->
 1838: 	    ok;
 1839: 	{CAddr, 0, CData1} when CAddr =/= undefined ->
 1840: 	    ok = gen_udp:send(S, CAddr, 0, SData),
 1841:             SData1 = local_handshake_data(S, SData),
 1842: 	    {SAddr, 0, SData1} = ok(gen_tcp:recv(C, 112)),
 1843: 	    ok
 1844: 
 1845:     end.
 1846: 
 1847: local_handshake_data(S, Data) when is_list(Data) ->
 1848:     case inet:getopts(S, [mode]) of
 1849:         {ok,[{mode,binary}]} ->
 1850:             list_to_binary(Data);
 1851:         {ok,[{mode,list}]} ->
 1852:             Data
 1853:     end.
 1854: 
 1855: 
 1856: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
 1857: %% Open a passive socket. Create a socket that reads from it.
 1858: %% Then close the socket.
 1859: recv_close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1860:     ?P("begin"),
 1861:     {ok, Sock} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{active, false}]),
 1862:     RECV = fun() ->
 1863:                    ?P("try recv"),
 1864:                    Res = gen_udp:recv(Sock, 0),
 1865:                    ?P("recv res: ~p", [Res]),
 1866:                    exit(Res)
 1867:            end,
 1868:     ?P("spawn reader"),
 1869:     {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(RECV),
 1870:     receive
 1871:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, PreReason} ->
 1872:             %% Make sure id does not die for some other reason...
 1873:             ct:fail("Unexpected pre close from reader (~p): ~p",
 1874:                           [Pid, PreReason])
 1875:     after 5000 -> % Just in case...
 1876:             ok
 1877:     end,
 1878:     ?P("close socket"),
 1879:     ok = gen_udp:close(Sock),
 1880:     ?P("await reader termination"),
 1881:     receive
 1882:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, {error, closed}} ->
 1883:             ?P("expected reader termination result"),
 1884:             ok;
 1885:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, PostReason} ->
 1886:             ?P("unexpected reader termination: ~p", [PostReason]),
 1887:             ct:fail("Unexpected post close from reader (~p): ~p",
 1888:                           [Pid, PostReason])
 1889:     after 5000 ->
 1890:             ?P("unexpected reader termination timeout"),
 1891:             demonitor(MRef, [flush]),
 1892:             exit(Pid, kill),
 1893:             ct:fail("Reader (~p) termination timeout", [Pid])
 1894:     end,
 1895:     ?P("done"),
 1896:     ok.
 1897: 
 1898: 
 1899: 
 1900: 
 1901: %% Test that connect/3 has effect.
 1902: connect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1903:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1904:             fun() -> do_connect(Config) end).
 1905: 
 1906: do_connect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1907:     ?P("begin"),
 1908:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
 1909:     ?P("try create first socket"),
 1910:     {ok, S1} = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
 1911:     {ok, P1} = inet:port(S1),
 1912:     ?P("try create second socket"),
 1913:     {ok, S2} = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
 1914:     ?P("try set second socket active: false: "
 1915:        "~n   ~p", [inet:info(S2)]),
 1916:     ok = inet:setopts(S2, [{active, false}]),
 1917:     ?P("try close first socket"),
 1918:     ok = gen_udp:close(S1),
 1919: 
 1920:     %% Test if this helps...
 1921:     ?P("sleep some"),
 1922:     ct:sleep({seconds, 5}),
 1923: 
 1924:     case os:type() of
 1925: 	{win32, nt} ->
 1926: 	    ok;
 1927: 	_ ->
 1928: 	    ?P("try some doomed connect targets: ~p", [P1]),
 1929: 	    {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:connect(S2, "", ?CLOSED_PORT),
 1930: 	    {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:connect(S2, '', ?CLOSED_PORT),
 1931: 	    {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:connect(S2, ".", ?CLOSED_PORT),
 1932: 	    {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:connect(S2, '.', ?CLOSED_PORT),
 1933: 	    ok
 1934:     end,
 1935: 
 1936:     ?P("try connect second socket to: ~p, ~p", [Addr, P1]),
 1937:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S2, Addr, P1),
 1938:     ?P("try send on second socket"),
 1939:     ok = gen_udp:send(S2, <<16#deadbeef:32>>),
 1940:     ?P("try recv on second socket - expect failure when"
 1941:        "~n   Socket Info: ~p", [inet:info(S2)]),
 1942:     ok = case gen_udp:recv(S2, 0, 500) of
 1943: 	     {error, econnrefused = R} -> ?P("expected failure: ~w", [R]), ok;
 1944: 	     {error, econnreset   = R} -> ?P("expected failure: ~w", [R]), ok;
 1945: 	     Other -> 
 1946:                  ?P("UNEXPECTED failure: ~p:"
 1947:                     "~n   ~p", [Other, inet:info(S2)]),
 1948:                  Other
 1949: 	 end,
 1950:     ?P("done"),
 1951:     ok.
 1952: 
 1953: 
 1954: 
 1955: reconnect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1956:     Cond = fun() -> is_not_windows() end,
 1957:     Pre  = fun() ->
 1958:                    Addr = {127, 0, 0, 1},
 1959:                    case open_port_0(Config,
 1960:                                     [{debug, true}]) of
 1961:                        {ok, {S, Port}} ->
 1962:                            ?P("[unix] Socket opened: "
 1963:                               "~n   Socket:      ~p"
 1964:                               "~n   socket info: ~p"
 1965:                               "~n   SockName:    ~s"
 1966:                               "~n   PeerName:    ~s",
 1967:                               [S, inet:info(S), sn(S), pn(S)]),
 1968:                            #{local_addr => Addr,
 1969:                              socket     => S,
 1970:                              port       => Port};
 1971:                        {error, Reason} ->
 1972:                            skip(?F("Failed open initial port: "
 1973:                                    "~p", [Reason]))
 1974:                    end
 1975:            end,
 1976:     TC   = fun(State) -> do_reconnect(State) end,
 1977:     Post = fun(#{socket := S}) -> ok = gen_udp:close(S) end,
 1978:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1979:             Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1980: 
 1981: do_reconnect(#{local_addr := Addr,
 1982:                socket     := S,
 1983:                port       := Port}) ->
 1984:     XtrnAddr = {8,8,8,8},
 1985:     DestPort = 53,
 1986:     %% Connect to a local destination
 1987:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S, Addr, DestPort),
 1988:     ?P("Socket connected: "
 1989:        "~n   socket info: ~p"
 1990:        "~n   SockName:    ~s"
