 1991:        "~n   PeerName:    ~s", [inet:info(S), sn(S), pn(S)]),
 1992:     {ok, {Addr,      DestPort}} = inet:peername(S),
 1993:     {ok, {LocalAddr, Port}}     = inet:sockname(S),
 1994: 
 1995:     %% Reconnect to external destination
 1996:     ?P("try (re-)connect to (external): ~s", [atos({XtrnAddr, DestPort})]),
 1997:     case gen_udp:connect(S, XtrnAddr, DestPort) of
 1998:         ok ->
 1999:             ok;
 2000:         {error, Reason} ->
 2001:             ?P("Failed (re-)connect to external destination:"
 2002:                "~n   Extern Dest: ~s"
 2003:                "~n   Reason:      ~p", [atos({XtrnAddr, DestPort}), Reason]),
 2004:             ct:fail({extern_reconnect, Reason})
 2005:     end,
 2006:     ?P("Socket (re-)connected: "
 2007:        "~n   socket info: ~p"
 2008:        "~n   SockName:    ~s"
 2009:        "~n   PeerName:    ~s", [inet:info(S), sn(S), pn(S)]),
 2010:     {ok, {XtrnAddr,     DestPort}} = inet:peername(S),
 2011:     {ok, {RoutableAddr, Port}}     = inet:sockname(S),
 2012: 
 2013:     ?P("verify socket (routable) addr: ~p", [RoutableAddr]),
 2014:     %% We should have a non-loopback address here
 2015:     true = RoutableAddr =/= LocalAddr,
 2016: 
 2017:     %% Reconnect to local addr
 2018:     ?P("(re-)connect to local address: ~s", [atos({Addr, DestPort})]),
 2019:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S, Addr, DestPort),
 2020:     ?P("Socket (re-)connected: "
 2021:        "~n   socket info: ~p"
 2022:        "~n   SockName:    ~s"
 2023:        "~n   PeerName:    ~s", [inet:info(S), sn(S), pn(S)]),
 2024:     {ok, {Addr,      DestPort}} = inet:peername(S),
 2025:     {ok, {LocalAddr, Port}}     = inet:sockname(S),
 2026: 
 2027:     ?P("done"),
 2028:     ok.
 2029: 
 2030: pn(S) ->
 2031:     case inet:peername(S) of
 2032:         {ok, Addr} ->
 2033:             atos(Addr);
 2034:         {error, _} ->
 2035:             "undefined"
 2036:     end.
 2037: 
 2038: sn(S) ->
 2039:     case inet:sockname(S) of
 2040:         {ok, Addr} ->
 2041:             atos(Addr);
 2042:         {error, _} ->
 2043:             "undefined"
 2044:     end.
 2045: 
 2046: atos({A, P}) when is_tuple(A) andalso is_integer(P) ->
 2047:     ?F("~s:~w", [inet_parse:ntoa(A), P]).
 2048:             
 2049: %% For Linux to keep the port when we reconnect;
 2050: %% we need to first bind to a specific port.
 2051: %% If we bind to port 0 and get an ephemeral port
 2052: %% it apparently can change when we reconnect to a different
 2053: %% destination depending on routing and interfaces.
 2054: %%
 2055: %% I consider this a workaround for a Linux bug,
 2056: %% ironically in a test case that tests
 2057: %% a workaround for another Linux bug (related)...
 2058: %%
 2059: open_port_0(Config, Opts) ->
 2060:     open_port_0(Config, 0, Opts, 10).
 2061: %%
 2062: open_port_0(Config, Port, Opts, N) ->
 2063:     case ?OPEN(Config, Port, Opts) of
 2064:         {ok, S} ->
 2065:             if
 2066:                 Port =:= 0 ->
 2067:                     {ok, Port_1} = inet:port(S),
 2068:                     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 2069:                     %% Speculate that we can open a socket with that port
 2070:                     open_port_0(Config, Port_1, Opts, N);
 2071:                 true ->
 2072:                     ?P("Socket port: ~w", [Port]),
 2073:                     {ok, {S, Port}}
 2074:             end;
 2075:         {error, eaddrinuse} when Port =/= 0 ->
 2076:             open_port_0(Config, 0, Opts, N - 1);
 2077:         {error, _} = Error ->
 2078:             Error
 2079:     end.
 2080: 
 2081: 
 2082: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2083: 
 2084: implicit_inet6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2085:     ?TC_TRY(implicit_inet6, fun() -> do_implicit_inet6(Config) end).
 2086: 
 2087: do_implicit_inet6(Config) ->
 2088:     Host = ok(inet:gethostname()),
 2089:     case inet:getaddr(Host, inet6) of
 2090: 	{ok, {16#fe80,0,0,0,_,_,_,_} = Addr} ->
 2091: 	     ?SKIPT("Got link local IPv6 address: "
 2092:                     ++inet:ntoa(Addr));
 2093: 	{ok, Addr} ->
 2094: 	    implicit_inet6(Config, Host, Addr);
 2095: 	{error, Reason} ->
 2096: 	    ?SKIPT("Can not look up IPv6 address: "
 2097:                    ++atom_to_list(Reason))
 2098:     end.
 2099: 
 2100: implicit_inet6(Config, Host, Addr) ->
 2101:     Active   = {active,false},
 2102:     Loopback = {0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1},
 2103:     ?P("try 1 with explicit inet6 on loopback"),
 2104:     S1 = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [inet6, Active, {ip, Loopback}]) of
 2105:              {ok, Sock1} ->
 2106:                  Sock1;
 2107:              {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason1} ->
 2108:                  ?SKIPT(open_failed_str(Reason1));
 2109:              _ ->
 2110:                  ?SKIPT("IPv6 not supported")
 2111:          end,
 2112:     implicit_inet6(Config, S1, Active, Loopback),
 2113:     ok = gen_udp:close(S1),
 2114: 
 2115:     %%
 2116:     Localaddr = ok(get_localaddr()),
 2117:     ?P("try 2 on local addr (~p)", [Localaddr]),
 2118:     S2 = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Localaddr}, Active]) of
 2119:              {ok, Sock2} ->
 2120:                  Sock2;
 2121:              {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason2} ->
 2122:                  ?SKIPT(open_failed_str(Reason2))
 2123:          end,
 2124:     implicit_inet6(Config, S2, Active, Localaddr),
 2125:     ok = gen_udp:close(S2),
 2126: 
 2127:     %%
 2128:     ?P("try 3 on addr ~p (~p)", [Addr, Host]),
 2129:     S3 = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr, Addr}, Active]) of
 2130:              {ok, Sock3} ->
 2131:                  Sock3;
 2132:              {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason3} ->
 2133:                  ?SKIPT(open_failed_str(Reason3))
 2134:          end,
 2135:     implicit_inet6(Config, S3, Active, Addr),
 2136:     ok = gen_udp:close(S3),
 2137:     ok.
 2138: 
 2139: implicit_inet6(Config, S1, Active, Addr) ->
 2140:     ?P("get (\"local\") port number"),
 2141:     P1 = ok(inet:port(S1)),
 2142:     ?P("open \"remote\" socket"),
 2143:     S2 = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [inet6, Active]) of
 2144:              {ok, Sock2} ->
 2145:                  Sock2;
 2146:              {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason3} ->
 2147:                  ?SKIPT(open_failed_str(Reason3))
 2148:          end,
 2149:     ?P("get (\"remote\") port number"),
 2150:     P2 = ok(inet:port(S2)),
 2151:     ?P("connect (\"remote\") socket (to ~p:~p)", [Addr, P1]),
 2152:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S2, Addr, P1),
 2153:     ?P("connect (\"local\") socket (to ~p:~p)", [Addr, P2]),
 2154:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S1, Addr, P2),
 2155:     ?P("peername of \"local\" socket"),
 2156:     {Addr,P2} = ok(inet:peername(S1)),
 2157:     ?P("peername of \"remote\" socket"),
 2158:     {Addr,P1} = ok(inet:peername(S2)),
 2159:     ?P("sockname of \"local\" socket"),
 2160:     {Addr,P1} = ok(inet:sockname(S1)),
 2161:     ?P("sockname of \"remote\" socket"),
 2162:     {Addr,P2} = ok(inet:sockname(S2)),
 2163:     ?P("send ping on \"local\" socket (to ~p:~p)", [Addr, P2]),
 2164:     %% On some platforms its allowed to specify address and port
 2165:     %% (that is; when useing sendto) *even* if the socket is connected
 2166:     %% (assuming the send destination is the same as connected destination).
 2167:     %% But on other platforms, e.g. FreeBSD, this is *not* allowed!
 2168:     %% Linux:
 2169:     %%   EISCONN
 2170:     %%      The connection-mode socket was connected already but a recipient
 2171:     %%      was specified. (Now either this error is returned, or the re-
 2172:     %%      cipient specification is ignored.)
 2173:     %% FreeBSD:
 2174:     %%   [EISCONN]    A destination address was specified and the socket is
 2175:     %%                already connected.
 2176:     case gen_udp:send(S1, Addr, P2, "ping") of
 2177:         ok ->
 2178:             ?P("recv ping on \"remote\" socket (from ~p:~p)", [Addr, P1]),
 2179:             {Addr,P1,"ping"} = ok(gen_udp:recv(S2, 1024, 1000)),
 2180:             ?P("send pong on \"remote\" socket (to ~p:~p)", [Addr, P1]),
 2181:             ok = gen_udp:send(S2, Addr, P1, "pong"),
 2182:             ?P("recv ping on \"local\" socket (from ~p:~p)", [Addr, P2]),
 2183:             {Addr,P2,"pong"} = ok(gen_udp:recv(S1, 1024)),
 2184:             ?P("close \"remote\" socket"),
 2185:             ok = gen_udp:close(S2),
 2186:             ok;
 2187:         {error, eisconn} ->
 2188:             ?P("socket is connect => *not* allowed to use sendto"),
 2189:             ok = gen_udp:send(S1, "ping"),
 2190:             %% Not allowed to specify address *at all* for a connected socket
 2191:             ?P("recv ping on \"remote\" socket (from ~p:~p)", [Addr, P1]),
 2192:             {Addr,P1,"ping"} = ok(gen_udp:recv(S2, 1024, 1000)),
 2193:             ?P("send pong on \"remote\" socket (to ~p:~p)", [Addr, P1]),
 2194:             ok = gen_udp:send(S2, "pong"),
 2195:             ?P("recv ping on \"local\" socket (from ~p:~p)", [Addr, P2]),
 2196:             {Addr,P2,"pong"} = ok(gen_udp:recv(S1, 1024)),
 2197:             ?P("close \"remote\" socket"),
 2198:             ok = gen_udp:close(S2),
 2199:             ok
 2200:     end.
 2201: 
 2202: 
 2203: 
 2204: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2205: 
 2206: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2207: %% We create a socket, then spawns processes that create
 2208: %% monitors to it...
 2209: socket_monitor1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2210:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2211:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor1,
 2212:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor1(Config) end).
 2213: 
 2214: do_socket_monitor1(Config) ->
 2215:     ?P("begin"),
 2216:     Self         = self(),
 2217:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2218:     {ok, Sock1} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2219:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 2220:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 2221: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 2222: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 2223: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2224: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 2225: 	 end,
 2226:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2227:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Sock1, F1),
 2228:     ?P("await client ready"),
 2229:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 2230:     ?P("close socket"),
 2231:     gen_udp:close(Sock1),
 2232:     ?P("await client termination"),
 2233:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2234:     ?P("done"),
 2235:     ok.
 2236: 
 2237: sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType) ->
 2238:     sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, "client").
 2239: 
 2240: sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, Name) ->
 2241:     receive
 2242: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) andalso 
 2243: 					     (Mon  =:= ExpMon)  andalso 
 2244: 					     (Sock =:= ExpSock) ->
 2245: 	    ?P("[~s] received expected (socket) down message: "
 2246: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 2247: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 2248: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 2249: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 2250: 	    exit(ok);
 2251: 
 2252: 	Any ->
 2253: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected message: "
 2254: 	       "~n   ~p", [Name, Any]),
 2255: 	    exit({unexpected_message, Any})
 2256:     end.
 2257: 
 2258: sm_await_client_ready(Pid) ->
 2259:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid, "client").
 2260: 
 2261: sm_await_client_ready(Pid, Name) ->
 2262:     receive
 2263: 	{Pid, ready} ->
 2264: 	    ?P("received ~s ready", [Name])
 2265:     end.
 2266: 
 2267: sm_await_down(Pid, Mon, ExpRes) ->
 2268:     receive
 2269: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, ExpRes} ->
 2270: 	    ?P("received expected process down message from ~p", [Pid]),
 2271: 	    ok;
 2272: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, UnexpRes} ->
 2273: 	    ?P("received unexpected process down message from ~p: "
 2274: 	       "~n   ~p", [Pid, UnexpRes]),
 2275: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_down, UnexpRes})
 2276:     end.
 2277: 
 2278: 
 2279: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2280: 
 2281: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2282: %% We create "many" socket(s), then spawn processes that create
 2283: %% monitors to them...
 2284: socket_monitor1_manys(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2285:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2286:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor1_manys,
 2287:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor1_manys(Config) end).
 2288: 
 2289: do_socket_monitor1_manys(Config) ->
 2290:     ?P("begin"),
 2291:     Self         = self(),
 2292:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2293:     ?P("[client] create socket(s)"),
 2294:     {ok, Sock1} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2295:     {ok, Sock2} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2296:     {ok, Sock3} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2297:     {ok, Sock4} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2298:     {ok, Sock5} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2299:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 2300:     F1 = fun(Sockets, Parent) when is_list(Sockets) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 2301: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor(s)"),
 2302: 		 Monitors = [{inet:monitor(Socket), Socket} ||
 2303: 				Socket <- Sockets],
 2304: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2305: 		 sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, Type)
 2306: 	 end,
 2307:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2308:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F([Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5], F1),
 2309:     ?P("await client ready"),
 2310:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 2311:     ?P("close socket(s)"),
 2312:     gen_udp:close(Sock1),
 2313:     gen_udp:close(Sock2),
 2314:     gen_udp:close(Sock3),
 2315:     gen_udp:close(Sock4),
 2316:     gen_udp:close(Sock5),
 2317:     ?P("await client termination"),
 2318:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2319:     ?P("done"),
 2320:     ok.
 2321: 
 2322: 
 2323: sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, ExpType) ->
 2324:     sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, ExpType, "client").
 2325: 
 2326: sm_await_socket_down2([], _ExpType, Name) ->
 2327:     ?P("[~s] all sockets down", [Name]),
 2328:     exit(ok);
 2329: sm_await_socket_down2(Mons, ExpType, Name) when is_list(Mons) ->
 2330:     ?P("[~s] await socket down", [Name]),
 2331:     receive
 2332: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) ->
 2333: 	    ?P("[~s] received expected (socket) down message: "
 2334: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 2335: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 2336: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 2337: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 2338: 	    case lists:keysearch(Mon, 1, Mons) of
 2339: 		{value, {Mon, Sock}} ->
 2340: 		    Mons2 = lists:keydelete(Mon, 1, Mons),
 2341: 		    sm_await_socket_down2(Mons2, ExpType, Name);
 2342: 		{value, Value} ->
 2343: 		    ?P("[~s] Unexpected socket down: "
 2344: 		       "~n   Value: ~p", [Name, Value]),
 2345: 		    ct:fail({unexpected_monitor, Mon, Value});
 2346: 		false ->
 2347: 		    ct:fail({unknown_monitor, Mon})
 2348: 	    end
 2349:     end.
 2350: 
 2351: 
 2352: 
 2353: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2354: 
 2355: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2356: %% We create a socket, then spawn client process(es) that create
 2357: %% monitors to it...
 2358: socket_monitor1_manyc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2359:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2360:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor1_manyc,
 2361:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor1_manyc(Config) end).
 2362: 
 2363: do_socket_monitor1_manyc(Config) ->
 2364:     ?P("begin"),
 2365:     Self         = self(),
 2366:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2367:     {ok, Sock1}  = ?OPEN(Config),
 2368:     F  = fun(S, Fun, Name) ->
 2369: 		 spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Name, Self) end)
 2370: 	 end,
 2371:     F1 = fun(Socket, Name, Parent) when is_list(Name) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 2372: 		 ?P("[~s] monitor socket", [Name]),
 2373: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 2374: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2375: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 2376: 	 end,
 2377:     ?P("spawn client(s)"),
 2378:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Sock1, F1, "client1"),
 2379:     {Pid2, Mon2} = F(Sock1, F1, "client2"),
 2380:     {Pid3, Mon3} = F(Sock1, F1, "client3"),
 2381:     {Pid4, Mon4} = F(Sock1, F1, "client4"),
 2382:     {Pid5, Mon5} = F(Sock1, F1, "client5"),
 2383:     ?P("await client(s) ready"),
 2384:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1, "client1"),
 2385:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid2, "client2"),
 2386:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid3, "client3"),
 2387:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid4, "client4"),
 2388:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid5, "client5"),
 2389:     ?P("close socket"),
 2390:     gen_udp:close(Sock1),
 2391:     ?P("await client(s) termination"),
 2392:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2393:     sm_await_down(Pid2, Mon2, ok),
 2394:     sm_await_down(Pid3, Mon3, ok),
 2395:     sm_await_down(Pid4, Mon4, ok),
 2396:     sm_await_down(Pid5, Mon5, ok),
 2397:     ?P("done"),
 2398:     ok.
 2399: 
 2400: 
 2401: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2402: 
 2403: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2404: %% We create a socket, then spawns processes that create
 2405: %% monitors to it...
 2406: socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2407:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2408:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor1_demon_after,
 2409:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config) end).
 2410: 
 2411: do_socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config) ->
 2412:     ?P("begin"),
 2413:     Self         = self(),
 2414:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2415:     {ok, Sock1}  = ?OPEN(Config),
 2416:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 2417:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 2418: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 2419: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 2420: 		 ?P("[client] sleep some"),
 2421: 		 ?SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 2422: 		 ?P("[client] cancel (socket) monitor"),
 2423: 		 inet:cancel_monitor(MRef),
 2424: 		 ?P("[client] announce ready"),
 2425: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2426: 		 sm_await_no_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 2427: 	 end,
 2428:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2429:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Sock1, F1),
 2430:     ?P("await client ready"),
 2431:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 2432:     ?P("close socket"),
 2433:     gen_udp:close(Sock1),
 2434:     ?P("await client termination"),
 2435:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2436:     ?P("done"),
 2437:     ok.
 2438: 
 2439: 
 2440: sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType) ->
 2441:     sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, "client").
 2442: 
 2443: sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, Name) ->
 2444:     receive
 2445: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) andalso 
 2446: 					     (Mon  =:= ExpMon)  andalso 
 2447: 					     (Sock =:= ExpSock) ->
 2448: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected (socket) down message: "
 2449: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 2450: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 2451: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 2452: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 2453: 	    exit({unexpected_down, Mon, Type, Sock, Info});
 2454: 
 2455: 	Any ->
 2456: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected message: "
 2457: 	       "~n   ~p", [Name, Any]),
 2458: 	    exit({unexpected_message, Any})
 2459: 
 2460:     after 1000 ->
 2461: 	    ?P("[~s] expected message timeout", [Name]),
 2462: 	    exit(ok)
 2463:     end.
 2464: 
 2465: 
 2466: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2467: 
 2468: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2469: %% Spawn a process that creates a socket, then spawns processes
 2470: %% that create monitors to it...
 2471: socket_monitor2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2472:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2473:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor2,
 2474:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor2(Config) end).
 2475: 
 2476: do_socket_monitor2(Config) ->
 2477:     ?P("begin"),
 2478:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2479:     Self         = self(),
 2480:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 2481: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 2482: 			      ?P("[owner] create (listen) socket"),
 2483: 			      {ok, S} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2484: 			      ?P("[owner] send socket to ctrl"),
 2485: 			      Self ! {socket, S},
 2486: 			      ?P("[owner] ready"),
 2487: 			      receive
 2488: 				  {Self, die} ->
 2489: 				      exit(normal)
 2490: 			      end
 2491: 		      end),
 2492:     Sock1 = receive
 2493:                 {socket, S} ->
 2494:                     ?P("received socket from owner"),
 2495:                     S;
 2496:                 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 2497:                     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "
 2498:                        "~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 2499:                     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 2500: 	     end,
 2501:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 2502:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 2503: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 2504: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 2505: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2506: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 2507: 	 end,
 2508:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2509:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Sock1, F1),
 2510:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2511:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 2512:     ?P("kill owner"),
 2513:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 2514:     ?P("await owner termination"),
 2515:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 2516:     ?P("await client termination"),
 2517:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2518:     ?P("done"),
 2519:     ok.
 2520: 
 2521: 
 2522: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2523: 
 2524: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2525: %% Spawn a process that creates "many" socket(s), then spawns
 2526: %% a process that create monitors to them...
 2527: 
 2528: socket_monitor2_manys(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2529:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2530:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor2_manys,
 2531:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor2_manys(Config) end).
 2532: 
 2533: do_socket_monitor2_manys(Config) ->
 2534:     ?P("begin"),
 2535:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2536:     Self         = self(),
 2537:     ?P("spawn owner"),
 2538:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 2539: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 2540: 			      ?P("[owner] create (listen) socket(s)"),
 2541: 			      {ok, S1} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2542: 			      {ok, S2} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2543: 			      {ok, S3} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2544: 			      {ok, S4} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2545: 			      {ok, S5} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2546: 			      ?P("[owner] send (listen) socket(s) to ctrl"),
 2547: 			      Self ! {socket, [S1, S2, S3, S4, S5]},
 2548: 			      ?P("[owner] ready"),
 2549: 			      receive
 2550: 				  {Self, die} ->
 2551: 				      exit(normal)
 2552: 			      end
 2553: 		      end),
 2554:     ?P("await sockets (from owner)"),
 2555:     Socks = receive
 2556:                 {socket, Ss} ->
 2557:                     ?P("received socket(s) from owner"),
 2558:                     Ss;
 2559:                 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 2560:                     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "
 2561:                        "~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 2562:                     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 2563:             end,
 2564:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 2565:     F1 = fun(Sockets, Parent) when is_list(Sockets) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 2566: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor(s)"),
 2567: 		 Monitors = [{inet:monitor(Socket), Socket} ||
 2568: 				Socket <- Sockets],
 2569: 		 ?P("[client] announce ready"),
 2570: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2571: 		 sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, Type)
 2572: 	 end,
 2573:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2574:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Socks, F1),
 2575:     ?P("await client ready"),
 2576:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 2577:     ?P("kill owner"),
 2578:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 2579:     ?P("await owner (~p) termination", [OwnerPid]),
 2580:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 2581:     ?P("await client termination"),
 2582:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2583:     ?P("done"),
 2584:     ok.
 2585: 
 2586: 
 2587: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2588: 
 2589: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2590: %% Spawn a process that creates a socket, then spawns (client)
 2591: %% processes that create monitors to it...
 2592: socket_monitor2_manyc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2593:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2594:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor2_manyc,
 2595:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor2_manyc(Config) end).
 2596: 
 2597: do_socket_monitor2_manyc(Config) ->
 2598:     ?P("begin"),
 2599:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2600:     Self         = self(),
 2601:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 2602: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 2603: 			      {ok, S} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2604: 			      Self ! {socket, S},
 2605: 			      receive
 2606: 				  {Self, die} ->
 2607: 				      exit(normal)
 2608: 			      end
 2609: 		      end),
 2610:     Sock1 = receive
 2611: 		 {socket, S} ->
 2612: 		     ?P("received socket from owner"),
 2613: 		     S;
 2614: 		 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 2615: 		     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "
 2616: 			"~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 2617: 		     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 2618: 	     end,
 2619:     F  = fun(S, Fun, Name) ->
 2620: 		 spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Name, Self) end)
 2621: 	 end,
 2622:     F1 = fun(Socket, Name, Parent) when is_list(Name) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 2623: 		 ?P("[~s] create monitor", [Name]),
 2624: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 2625: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2626: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type, Name)
 2627: 	 end,
 2628:     ?P("spawn client(s)"),
 2629:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Sock1, F1, "client1"),
 2630:     {Pid2, Mon2} = F(Sock1, F1, "client2"),
 2631:     {Pid3, Mon3} = F(Sock1, F1, "client3"),
 2632:     {Pid4, Mon4} = F(Sock1, F1, "client4"),
 2633:     {Pid5, Mon5} = F(Sock1, F1, "client5"),
 2634:     ?P("await client(s) ready"),
 2635:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1, "client1"),
 2636:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid2, "client2"),
 2637:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid3, "client3"),
 2638:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid4, "client4"),
 2639:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid5, "client5"),
 2640:     ?P("kill owner"),
 2641:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 2642:     ?P("await owner termination"),
 2643:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 2644:     ?P("await client(s) termination"),
 2645:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2646:     sm_await_down(Pid2, Mon2, ok),
 2647:     sm_await_down(Pid3, Mon3, ok),
 2648:     sm_await_down(Pid4, Mon4, ok),
 2649:     sm_await_down(Pid5, Mon5, ok),
 2650:     ?P("done"),
 2651:     ok.
 2652: 
 2653: 
 2654: 
 2655: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2656: 
 2657: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2658: %% Spawn a process that creates a socket, then spawns (client)
 2659: %% processes that create monitors to it...
 2660: otp_17492(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2661:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2662:     ?TC_TRY(otp_17492, fun() -> do_otp_17492(Config) end).
 2663: 
 2664: do_otp_17492(Config) ->
 2665:     ?P("begin"),
 2666: 
 2667:     Self = self(),
 2668: 
 2669:     ?P("try create socket"),
 2670:     {ok, L} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, []),
 2671: 
 2672:     ?P("try get (created) socket info"),
 2673:     try inet:info(L) of
 2674: 	#{owner := Owner} = Info when is_pid(Owner) andalso (Owner =:= Self) ->
 2675: 	    ?P("(created) socket info: ~p", [Info]);
 2676: 	OBadInfo ->
 2677: 	    ?P("(created) socket info: ~p", [OBadInfo]),
 2678: 	    (catch gen_udp:close(L)),
 2679: 	    ct:fail({invalid_created_info, OBadInfo})
 2680:     catch
 2681: 	OC:OE:OS ->
 2682: 	    ?P("Failed get (created) Listen socket info: "
 2683: 	       "~n   Class: ~p"
 2684: 	       "~n   Error: ~p"
 2685: 	       "~n   Stack: ~p", [OC, OE, OS]),
 2686: 	    (catch gen_udp:close(L)),
 2687: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_created_info_result, {OC, OE, OS}})
 2688:     end,
 2689: 
 2690:     ?P("try close socket"),
 2691:     ok = gen_udp:close(L),
 2692: 
 2693:     ?P("try get (closed) socket info"),
 2694:     try inet:info(L) of
 2695: 	#{states := [closed]} = CInfo when is_port(L) ->
 2696: 	    ?P("(closed) socket info: "
 2697: 	       "~n   ~p", [CInfo]);
 2698: 	#{rstates := [closed], wstates := [closed]} = CInfo ->
 2699: 	    ?P("(closed) socket info: "
 2700: 	       "~n   ~p", [CInfo]);
 2701: 	CBadInfo ->
 2702: 	    ?P("(closed) socket info: ~p", [CBadInfo]),
 2703: 	    ct:fail({invalid_closed_info, CBadInfo})
 2704:     catch
 2705: 	CC:CE:CS ->
 2706: 	    ?P("Failed get (closed) socket info: "
 2707: 	       "~n   Class: ~p"
 2708: 	       "~n   Error: ~p"
 2709: 	       "~n   Stack: ~p", [CC, CE, CS]),
 2710: 	    (catch gen_udp:close(L)),
 2711: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_closed_info_result, {CC, CE, CS}})
 2712:     end,
 2713: 
 2714:     ?P("done"),
 2715:     ok.
 2716: 
 2717: 
 2718: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2719: 
 2720: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2721: 
 2722: %% Here we use socket:sockaddr_in6() when creating and using the
 2723: %% socket(s).
 2724: %%
 2725: t_simple_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2726:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 2727:             fun() -> ?LIB:has_support_ipv6() end,
 2728:             fun() ->
 2729:                     Domain = inet6,
 2730:                     LocalAddr =
 2731:                         case ?LIB:which_local_addr(Domain) of
 2732:                             {ok, LA} ->
 2733:                                 LA;
 2734:                         {error, _} ->
 2735:                             skip("No local address")
 2736:                     end,
 2737:                     SockAddr = #{family   => Domain,
 2738:                                  addr     => LocalAddr,
 2739:                                  port     => 0},
 2740:                     do_simple_sockaddr_send_recv(SockAddr, Config)
 2741:             end).
 2742: 
 2743: 
 2744: t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2745:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 2746:             fun() ->
 2747:                     ?LIB:has_support_ipv6(),
 2748:                     is_net_supported(),
 2749:                     is_not_darwin()
 2750:             end,
 2751:             fun() ->
 2752:                     Domain = inet6,
 2753:                     LinkLocalAddr =
 2754:                         case ?LIB:which_link_local_addr(Domain) of
 2755:                             {ok, LLA} ->
 2756:                                 LLA;
 2757:                             {error, _} ->
 2758:                                 skip("No link local address")
 2759:                         end,
 2760:                     Filter =
 2761:                         fun(#{addr := #{family := D,
 2762:                                         addr   := A}} = C) ->
 2763:                                 if 
 2764:                                     (D =:= Domain) andalso
 2765:                                     (A =:= LinkLocalAddr) ->
 2766:                                         ?P("found link-local candidate: "
 2767:                                            "~n   ~p", [C]),
 2768:                                         true;
 2769:                                     true ->
 2770:                                         false
 2771:                                 end;
 2772:                            (_) ->
 2773:                                 false
 2774:                         end,
 2775:                     case net:getifaddrs(Filter) of
 2776:                         {ok, [#{addr := #{scope_id := ScopeID}}=H|T]} ->
 2777:                             ?P("found link-local candidate(s): "
 2778:                                "~n   Candidate:       ~p"
 2779:                                "~n   Rest Candidate:  ~p", [H, T]),
 2780:                             SockAddr = #{family   => Domain,
 2781:                                          addr     => LinkLocalAddr,
 2782:                                          port     => 0,
 2783:                                          scope_id => ScopeID},
 2784:                             do_simple_sockaddr_send_recv(SockAddr, Config);
 2785:                         {ok, _} ->
 2786:                             skip("Scope ID not found");
 2787:                         {error, R} ->
 2788:                             skip({failed_getifaddrs, R})
 2789:                     end
 2790:             end).
 2791: 
 2792: t_simple_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2793:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2794:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 2795:             fun() -> ok end,
 2796:             fun() ->
 2797:                     Domain = inet,
 2798:                     LocalAddr =
 2799:                         case ?LIB:which_local_addr(Domain) of
 2800:                             {ok, LA} ->
 2801:                                 LA;
 2802:                         {error, _} ->
 2803:                             skip("No local address")
 2804:                     end,
 2805:                     SockAddr = #{family   => Domain,
 2806:                                  addr     => LocalAddr,
 2807:                                  port     => 0},
 2808:                     do_simple_sockaddr_send_recv(SockAddr, Config)
 2809:             end).
 2810: 
 2811: t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2812:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 2813:             fun() -> ok end,
 2814:             fun() ->
 2815:                     Domain = inet,
 2816:                     LinkLocalAddr =
 2817:                         case ?LIB:which_link_local_addr(Domain) of
 2818:                             {ok, LLA} ->
 2819:                                 LLA;
 2820:                             {error, _} ->
 2821:                                 skip("No link local address")
 2822:                         end,
 2823:                     SockAddr = #{family => Domain,
 2824:                                  addr   => LinkLocalAddr,
 2825:                                  port   => 0},
 2826:                     do_simple_sockaddr_send_recv(SockAddr, Config)
 2827:             end).
 2828: 
 2829: 
 2830: do_simple_sockaddr_send_recv(#{family := _Fam} = SockAddr, _) ->
 2831:     %% Create the server
 2832:     Self   = self(),
 2833:     ?P("~n      SockAddr: ~p", [SockAddr]),
 2834:     ServerF = fun() ->
 2835:                       ?P("[server] try create socket"),
 2836:                       Sock =
 2837:                           try gen_udp:open(0, [{ifaddr, SockAddr},
 2838:                                                {active, true},
 2839:                                                binary]) of
 2840:                               {ok, S} ->
 2841:                                   S;
 2842:                               {error, OReason} ->
 2843:                                   ?P("[server] open error: "
 2844:                                      "~n      Reason: ~p", [OReason]),
 2845:                                   exit({open_error, OReason})
 2846:                           catch
 2847:                               OC:OE:OS ->
 2848:                                   ?P("[server] open failure: "
 2849:                                      "~n      Error Class: ~p"
 2850:                                      "~n      Error:       ~p"
 2851:                                      "~n      Call Stack:  ~p", [OC, OE, OS]),
 2852:                                   exit({open_failure, {OC, OE, OS}})
 2853:                           end,
 2854:                       ?P("[server] try get port"),
 2855:                       {ok, Port}  = inet:port(Sock),
 2856:                       ?P("[server] port: ~w", [Port]),
 2857:                       Self ! {{port, Port}, self()},
 2858: 
 2859: 
 2860:                       %% --- message sequance 1 ---
 2861: 
 2862:                       ?P("[server] await message 1"),
 2863:                       {CIP, CPort} =
 2864:                           receive
 2865:                               {udp, Sock, CIP1, CPort1, <<"hej">>} ->
 2866:                                   ?P("[server] received expected message 1 - "
 2867:                                      "connect to *this* client"),
 2868:                                   ok = gen_udp:connect(Sock, CIP1, CPort1),
 2869:                                   ?P("[server] send reply"),
 2870:                                   case gen_udp:send(Sock, "hopp") of
 2871:                                       ok -> 
 2872:                                           {CIP1, CPort1};
 2873:                                       {error, ehostunreach = Reason1} ->
 2874:                                           ?P("[server] send failed: ~p",
 2875:                                              [Reason1]),
 2876:                                           exit({skip, Reason1});
 2877:                                       {error, enetunreach = Reason1} ->
 2878:                                           ?P("[server] send failed: ~p",
 2879:                                              [Reason1]),
 2880:                                           exit({skip, Reason1});
 2881:                                       {error, Reason1} ->
 2882:                                           exit({send_failed, Reason1})
 2883:                                   end
 2884:                           after 5000 ->
 2885:                                   ?P("[server] receive (1) timeout:"
 2886:                                      "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 2887:                                   exit(receive_timeout)
 2888:                           end,
 2889: 
 2890: 
 2891:                       %% --- message sequance 2 ---
 2892: 
 2893:                       ?P("[server] await message 2"),
 2894:                       receive
 2895:                           {udp, Sock, CIP2, CPort2, <<"hej">>}
 2896:                             when (CIP2 =:= CIP) andalso (CPort2 =:= CPort) ->
 2897:                               ?P("[server] received expected message 2 - "
 2898:                                  "send reply"),
 2899:                               case gen_udp:send(Sock, "hopp") of
 2900:                                   ok -> 
 2901:                                       ok;
 2902:                                   {error, ehostunreach = Reason2} ->
 2903:                                       ?P("[server] send failed: ~p",
 2904:                                          [Reason2]),
 2905:                                       exit({skip, Reason2});
 2906:                                   {error, enetunreach = Reason2} ->
 2907:                                       ?P("[server] send failed: ~p",
 2908:                                          [Reason2]),
 2909:                                       exit({skip, Reason2});
 2910:                                   {error, Reason2} ->
 2911:                                       exit({send_failed, Reason2})
 2912:                               end
 2913:                       after 5000 ->
 2914:                               ?P("[server] receive (2) timeout:"
 2915:                                  "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 2916:                               exit(receive_timeout)
 2917:                       end,
 2918: 
 2919: 
 2920:                       %% --- message sequance 3 ---
 2921: 
 2922:                       ?P("[server] await message 3"),
 2923:                       receive
 2924:                           {udp, Sock, CIP3, CPort3, <<"hej">>}
 2925:                             when (CIP3 =:= CIP) andalso (CPort3 =:= CPort) ->
 2926:                               ?P("[server] received expected message 3 - "
 2927:                                  "send reply"),
 2928:                               ok = gen_udp:send(Sock, "hopp")
 2929:                       after 5000 ->
 2930:                               ?P("[server] receive (3) timeout:"
 2931:                                  "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 2932:                               exit(receive_timeout)
 2933:                       end,
 2934: 
 2935: 
 2936:                       %% --- message sequance 4 ---
 2937: 
 2938:                       ?P("[server] await message 4 - should be none!"),
 2939:                       receive
 2940:                           {udp, Sock, CIP4, CPort4, <<"hej">>} ->
 2941:                               ?P("[server] received unexpected message 4:"
 2942:                                  "~n      Address: ~p"
 2943:                                  "~n      Port:    ~p", [CIP4, CPort4]),
 2944:                               exit({unexpected_message, CIP4, CPort4})
 2945:                       after
 2946:                           1000 ->
 2947:                               ?P("Received nothing - expected"),
 2948:                               Self ! {nothing, self()}
 2949:                       end,
 2950: 
 2951:                       ?P("[server] await termination command"),
 2952:                       receive
 2953:                           {die, Self} ->
 2954:                               ?P("[server] terminating"),
 2955:                               (catch gen_udp:close(Sock)),
 2956:                               exit(normal)
 2957:                       end
 2958:               end,
 2959:     ?P("try start server"),
 2960:     Server = spawn_link(ServerF),
 2961:     ?P("server started - await port "),
 2962:     ServerPort = receive
 2963:                      {{port, Port}, Server} ->
 2964:                          Port;
 2965:                      {'EXIT', Server, Reason} ->
 2966:                          ?P("server died unexpectedly: "
 2967:                             "~n      ~p", [Reason]),
 2968:                          exit({unexpected_server_failure, Reason})
 2969:                  end,
 2970:     ?P("server port received: ~p", [ServerPort]),
 2971:     
 2972:     ?P("try connect to server"),
 2973:     ServerSockAddr = SockAddr#{port => ServerPort},
 2974:     {ok, CSock1} = gen_udp:open(0,
 2975:                                 [{ifaddr, SockAddr},
 2976:                                  {active, true},
 2977:                                  binary]),
 2978:     {ok, CSock2} = gen_udp:open(0,
 2979:                                 [{ifaddr, SockAddr},
 2980:                                  {active, true},
 2981:                                  binary]),
 2982:     ?P("client socket: "
 2983:        "~n      CSock 1: ~p"
 2984:        "~n      CPort 1: ~p"
 2985:        "~n      CSock 2: ~p"
 2986:        "~n      CPort 2: ~p",
 2987:        [CSock1, inet:port(CSock1), CSock2, inet:port(CSock2)]),
 2988: 
 2989: 
 2990:     %% --- message sequance 1 ---
 2991: 
 2992:     ?P("[csock 1] try (trad = address and port) send message 1"),
 2993:     case gen_udp:send(CSock1, maps:get(addr, SockAddr), ServerPort, "hej") of
 2994:         ok ->
 2995:             ok;
 2996:         {error, ehostunreach = Reason1} ->
 2997:             ?SKIPT(?F("send (1,1) failed: ~p", [Reason1]));
 2998:         {error, Reason1} ->
 2999:             ct:fail({send_failed, Reason1})
 3000:     end,
 3001:                  
 3002: 
 3003:     ?P("[csock 1] await reply message 1"),
 3004:     receive
 3005:         {udp, CSock1, _, _, <<"hopp">>} ->
 3006:             ?P("[csock 1] received expected reply message 1"),
 3007:             ok;
 3008: 
 3009:         {'EXIT', Server, {skip, SReason1}} ->
 3010:             ?P("received unexpected server skip exit (1):"
 3011:                "~n      ~p", [SReason1]),
 3012:             ?SKIPT(?F("server send (1,1) failed: ~p", [SReason1]));
 3013: 
 3014:         {'EXIT', Server, SReason1} ->
 3015:             ?P("received unexpected server exit (1):"
 3016:                "~n      ~p", [SReason1]),
 3017:             ct:fail({unexpected_server_exit, 1, SReason1})
 3018: 
 3019:     after 5000 ->
 3020:             ?P("receive (1) timeout:"
 3021:                "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 3022:             ct:fail(receive_timeout)
 3023:     end,
 3024: 
 3025: 
 3026:     %% --- message sequance 2 ---
 3027: 
 3028:     ?P("[csock 1] try (sockaddr) send message 2"),
 3029:     %% DstSockAddr = #{family => maps:get(family, SockAddr),
 3030:     %%                 addr   => maps:get(addr, SockAddr),
 3031:     %%                 port   => ServerPort},
 3032:     DstSockAddr = ServerSockAddr,
 3033:     case gen_udp:send(CSock1, DstSockAddr, "hej") of
 3034:         ok ->
 3035:             ok;
 3036:         {error, ehostunreach = Reason2} ->
 3037:             ?SKIPT(?F("send (1,2) failed: ~p", [Reason2]));
 3038:         {error, Reason2} ->
 3039:             ct:fail({send_failed, Reason2})
 3040:     end,
 3041:         
 3042: 
 3043:     ?P("[csock 1] await reply message 2"),
 3044:     receive
 3045:         {udp, CSock1, _, _, <<"hopp">>} ->
 3046:             ?P("[csock 1] received expected reply message 2"),
 3047:             ok;
 3048: 
 3049:         {'EXIT', Server, {skip, SReason2}} ->
 3050:             ?P("received unexpected server skip exit (2):"
 3051:                "~n      ~p", [SReason2]),
 3052:             ?SKIPT(?F("server send (1,2) failed: ~p", [SReason2]));
 3053: 
 3054:         {'EXIT', Server, SReason2} ->
 3055:             ?P("received unexpected server exit (2):"
 3056:                "~n.     ~p", [SReason2]),
 3057:             ct:fail({unexpected_server_exit, 2, SReason2})
 3058: 
 3059:     after 5000 ->
 3060:             ?P("[csock 1] receive (2) timeout:"
 3061:                "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 3062:             ct:fail(receive_timeout)
 3063:     end,
 3064: 
 3065: 
 3066:     %% --- message sequance 3 ---
 3067: 
 3068:     ?P("[csock 1] try connect to: "
 3069:        "~n      ~p", [ServerSockAddr]),
 3070:     ok = gen_udp:connect(CSock1, DstSockAddr),
 3071: 
 3072:     ?P("[csock 1] try send message 3"),
 3073:     ok = gen_udp:send(CSock1, "hej"),
 3074: 
 3075:     ?P("[csock 1] await reply message 3"),
 3076:     receive
 3077:         {udp, CSock1, _, _, <<"hopp">>} ->
 3078:             ?P("received expected reply message 3"),
 3079:             ok;
 3080: 
 3081:         {'EXIT', Server, SReason3} ->
 3082:             ?P("received unexpected server exit (3):"
 3083:                "~n.     ~p", [SReason3]),
 3084:             ct:fail({unexpected_server_exit, 3, SReason3})
 3085: 
 3086:     after 5000 ->
 3087:             ?P("[csock 1] receive (2) timeout:"
 3088:                "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 3089:             ct:fail(receive_timeout)
 3090: 
 3091:     end,
 3092: 
 3093: 
 3094:     %% --- message sequance 4 ---
 3095: 
 3096:     ?P("[csock 2] try (sockaddr) send message 4"),
 3097:     ok = gen_udp:send(CSock2, DstSockAddr, "hej"),
 3098: 
 3099:     ?P("[csock 2] await reply message 4 - expect failure"),
 3100:     receive
 3101:         {udp, CSock2, _, _, <<"hopp">>} ->
 3102:             ?P("[csock 2] received unexpected reply message 4"),
 3103:             exit(received_unexpected_message);
 3104:         {nothing, Server} ->
 3105:             ?P("[csock 2] server received nothing - expected"),
 3106:             ok
 3107:     end,
 3108: 
 3109: 
 3110:     ?P("terminate server"),
 3111:     Server ! {die, self()},
 3112: 
 3113:     ?P("await server termination"),
 3114:     receive
 3115:         {'EXIT', Server, normal} ->
 3116:             ok
 3117:     end,
 3118:     
 3119:     ?P("cleanup"),
 3120:     (catch gen_udp:close(CSock1)),
 3121:     (catch gen_udp:close(CSock2)),
 3122: 
 3123:     ?P("done"),
 3124:     ok.
 3125: 
 3126:     
 3127: 
 3128: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3129: 
 3130: %% Verify that the options [add|drop]_membership do not mess up
 3131: %% the options (including 'ip' which could not be added *after*).
 3132: %% This just attempts to very that the option processing is ok.
 3133: otp_18323_opts_processing(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3134:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 3135:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_otp_18323_opts_processing(Config) end).
 3136: 
 3137: do_otp_18323_opts_processing(_Config) ->
 3138:     ?P("begin"),
 3139: 
 3140:     do_otp_18323_opts_processing_verify(
 3141:       {add_membership,  {{239,1,2,3},{0,0,0,0}}}),
 3142: 
 3143:     do_otp_18323_opts_processing_verify(
 3144:       {drop_membership, {{239,1,2,3},{0,0,0,0}}}),
 3145: 
 3146:     ?P("done"),
 3147:     ok.
 3148: 
 3149: do_otp_18323_opts_processing_verify(MembershipOpt) ->
 3150:     Port   = 4321,
 3151:     RecBuf = 123456,
 3152:     Active = 10,
 3153:     IP     = {1,2,3,4},
 3154:     Opts   = [binary, MembershipOpt, {ip, IP}, {active, Active}],
 3155: 
 3156:     case inet:udp_options([{port, Port}, {recbuf, RecBuf} | Opts], inet_udp) of
 3157:         {ok, #udp_opts{ifaddr = IP,
 3158:                        port   = Port,
 3159:                        opts   = SockOpts}} ->
 3160:             ?P("Processed Socket Options: "
 3161:                "~n   IfAddr:    ~p"
 3162:                "~n   Port:      ~p"
 3163:                "~n   Sock Opts: ~p", [IP, Port, SockOpts]),
 3164:             %% Check that the recbuf and mode options are as expected
 3165:             %% The option 'binary' is shorthand for {mode, binary}
 3166:             {value, {recbuf, RecBuf}} = lists:keysearch(recbuf, 1, SockOpts),
 3167:             {value, {mode,   binary}} = lists:keysearch(mode,   1, SockOpts),
 3168:             {value, {active, Active}} = lists:keysearch(active, 1, SockOpts),
 3169:             ok;
 3170:         {error, Reason} ->
 3171:             exit(?F("Failed processing options: ~p", [Reason]))
 3172:     end.
 3173: 
 3174: 
 3175: 
 3176: 
 3177: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3178: 
 3179: %% Verify that the options [add|drop]_membership do not mess up
 3180: %% the options (including 'ip' which could not be added *after*).
 3181: otp_18323_open(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3182:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 3183:     Pre  = fun() ->
 3184:                    {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
 3185:                    #{local_addr => Addr}
 3186:            end,
 3187:     Case = fun(State) -> do_otp_18323_open(State) end,
 3188:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 3189:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Pre, Case, Post).
 3190: 
 3191: do_otp_18323_open(#{local_addr := Addr}) ->
 3192:     ?P("begin"),
 3193: 
 3194:     ROpts = [binary,
 3195:              {add_membership, {Addr,{0,0,0,0}}},
 3196:              {ip, Addr},
 3197:              {active,false},
 3198:              {debug, true}],
 3199:     SOpts = [{reuseaddr, true}, binary],
 3200: 
 3201:     ?P("create received socket"),
 3202:     {ok, R}     = gen_udp:open(0, ROpts),
 3203:     ?P("extract received socket port"),
 3204:     {ok, RPort} = inet:port(R),
 3205: 
 3206:     ?P("create sender socket"),
 3207:     {ok, S} = gen_udp:open(0, SOpts),
 3208: 
 3209:     ?P("send to receiver (at port ~w)", [RPort]),
 3210:     ok = gen_udp:send(S, Addr, RPort, <<"aaaaa">>),
 3211: 
 3212:     ?P("attempt to receive data on specified format binary)"),
 3213:     {ok, {_,_,<<"aaaaa">>}} = gen_udp:recv(R, 0, 200),
 3214: 
 3215:     ?P("done"),
 3216:     ok.
 3217: 
 3218: 
 3219: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3220: 
 3221: ok({ok,V}) -> V;
 3222: ok(NotOk) ->
 3223:     try throw(not_ok)
 3224:     catch
 3225: 	throw:not_ok:Stacktrace ->
 3226: 	    raise_error({not_ok, NotOk}, tl(Stacktrace))
 3227:     end.
 3228: 
 3229: raise_error(Reason, Stacktrace) ->
 3230:     erlang:raise(error, Reason, Stacktrace).
 3231: 
 3232: local_filename(Tag) ->
 3233:     "/tmp/" ?MODULE_STRING "_" ++ os:getpid() ++ "_" ++ atom_to_list(Tag).
 3234: 
 3235: bin_filename(String) ->
 3236:     unicode:characters_to_binary(String, file:native_name_encoding()).
 3237: 
 3238: delete_local_filenames() ->
 3239:     _ =
 3240: 	[file:delete(F) ||
 3241: 	    F <-
 3242: 		filelib:wildcard(
 3243: 		  "/tmp/" ?MODULE_STRING "_" ++ os:getpid() ++ "_*")],
 3244:     ok.
 3245: 
 3246: get_localaddr() ->
 3247:     get_localaddr(["localhost", "localhost6", "ip6-localhost"]).
 3248: 
 3249: get_localaddr([]) ->
 3250:     {error, localaddr_not_found};
 3251: get_localaddr([Localhost|Ls]) ->
 3252:     case inet:getaddr(Localhost, inet6) of
 3253:        {ok, LocalAddr} ->
 3254:            ?P("found local address: ~s ~p", [Localhost, LocalAddr]),
 3255:            {ok, LocalAddr};
 3256:        _ ->
 3257:            get_localaddr(Ls)
 3258:     end.
 3259: 
 3260: 
 3261: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3262: 
 3263: is_net_supported() ->
 3264:     try net:info() of
 3265:         #{} ->
 3266:             ok
 3267:     catch
 3268:         error : notsup ->
 3269:             not_supported(net)
 3270:     end.
 3271: 
 3272: 
 3273: is_not_darwin() ->
 3274:     is_not_platform(darwin, "Darwin").
 3275: 
 3276: is_not_windows() ->
 3277:     is_not_platform(win32, "Windows").
 3278: 
 3279: is_not_platform(Platform, PlatformStr)
 3280:   when is_atom(Platform) andalso is_list(PlatformStr) ->
 3281:       case os:type() of
 3282:         {unix, Platform} ->
 3283:             skip("This does not work on " ++ PlatformStr);
 3284:         {win32, nt} when (Platform =:= win32) ->
 3285:             skip("This does not work on " ++ PlatformStr);
 3286:         _ ->
 3287:             ok
 3288:     end.
 3289: 
 3290: 
 3291: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3292: 
 3293: not_supported(What) ->
 3294:     skip({not_supported, What}).
 3295: 
 3296: skip(Reason) ->
 3297:     throw({skip, Reason}).
 3298: 
 3299: 
 3300: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3301: 
 3302: which_info(Sock) ->
 3303:     which_info([istate, active], inet:info(Sock), #{}).
 3304: 
 3305: which_info([], _Info, Acc) ->
 3306:     Acc;
 3307: which_info([Key|Keys], Info, Acc) ->
 3308:     case maps:find(Key, Info) of
 3309:         {ok, Value} ->
 3310:             which_info(Keys, Info, Acc#{Key => Value});
 3311:         error ->
 3312:             which_info(Keys, Info, Acc)
 3313:     end.
 3314: 
 3315: 
 3316: mq() ->
 3317:     pi(messages).
 3318: 
 3319: pi(Item) ->
 3320:     {Item, Val} = process_info(self(), Item),
 3321:     Val.
 3322:

 3330: open_failed_str(Reason) ->
 3331:     ?F("Open failed: ~w", [Reason]).
